answer: Automotive technicians can be paid through various methods, including hourly wages, flat-rates or flag-rates, and commissions. The specific compensation method may depend on the company and the type of work the technician specializes in.

The amount they earn can also vary depending on geographical location. For example, automotive technicians in Alaska have the highest average pay of about $23.70 per hour or $49,400 per year. Some automotive technicians that work in aerospace products and parts manufacturing can earn about $32 per hour or $66,300 per year on average.

question: what is the difference between tartate and succinate
contexts:
["passage 1:9. Get help from a doctor now â€º. Medication duration: Succinate (toprol) is the long acting form of metoprolol where as tartrate (lopressor) is the shorter acting form. Toprol can be taken once a day and Lopressor is usually taken at least twice a day....Read more.Great you're all set!. Get help from a doctor now â€º. Medication duration: Succinate (toprol) is the long acting form of metoprolol where as tartrate (lopressor) is the shorter acting form. Toprol can be taken once a day and Lopressor is usually taken at least twice a day.

passage 2:Tartrate vs Succinate. The key difference between tartrate and succinate is that succinate is derived from the succinic acid and tartrate is derived from the tartaric acid. These two chemical substances are widely used in the beverage industry and drug manufacturing.Succinic acid is ethan-1,2-dicarboxylic acid. Succinate form of metoprolol is an extended release drug and it plays its role in the circulatory system for 24 hours. However, the tartrate form of metoprolol does not appear in the blood stream for 24 hours because metoprolol tartrate is an immediate-release drug.

passage 3:Release time. The primary difference between metoprolol succinate and metoprolol tartrate is the length of time that the drugs stay in your bloodstream. Metoprolol succinate will stay in a person's bloodstream for 24 complete hours. This means that the medication is a once per day pill.Metoprolol tartrate, on the other hand, will not stay in the bloodstream as long and thus needs to be taken at regular intervals.etoprolol succinate has a greater dehydrating effect. Thus, the side effects constipation and dry mouth are primarily associated with this version of the medication. Conversely, metoprolol tartrate may cause diarrhea. It also has the potential to cause sleep issues such as insomnia or unusual dreams.

"]
answer: The main difference between tartrate and succinate is that succinate is derived from succinic acid, while tartrate is derived from tartaric acid. In terms of medication, metoprolol succinate is an extended-release drug with a 24-hour effect, while metoprolol tartrate is an immediate-release drug that needs to be taken at regular intervals.
ground_truth: Succinate and tartrate are derived from succinic acid and tartaric acid respectively. They are both used in the beverage industry and drug manufacturing. Succinate, in the form of metoprolol succinate, is a long acting, extended release drug that stays in the bloodstream for 24 hours, allowing it to be taken once a day. It may have side effects such as constipation and dry mouth due to its dehydrating effect. On the other hand, tartrate, in the form of metoprolol tartrate, is shorter acting and does not stay in the bloodstream as long, requiring it to be taken at least twice a day. It may cause side effects such as diarrhea and sleep issues.

question: wat is dna
contexts:
["passage 1:Report Abuse. Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) is a nucleic acid that contains the genetic instructions used in the development and functioning of all known living organisms and some viruses. The main role of DNA molecules is the long-term storage of information.eport Abuse. Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) is a nucleic acid that contains the genetic instructions used in the development and functioning of all known living organisms and some viruses. The main role of DNA molecules is the long-term storage of information.

passage 2:DNA structure. DNA is made up of molecules called nucleotides. Each nucleotide contains a phosphate group, a sugar group and a nitrogen base. The four types of nitrogen bases are adenine (A), thymine (T), guanine (G) and cytosine (C).The order of these bases is what determines DNA's instructions, or genetic code.Similar to the way the order of letters in the alphabet can be used to form a word, the order of nitrogen bases in a DNA sequence forms genes, which in the language of the cell, tells cells how to make proteins.NA structure. DNA is made up of molecules called nucleotides. Each nucleotide contains a phosphate group, a sugar group and a nitrogen base. The four types of nitrogen bases are adenine (A), thymine (T), guanine (G) and cytosine (C).

passage 3:DNA is a double helix formed by base pairs attached to a sugar-phosphate backbone. DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, is the hereditary material in humans and almost all other organisms.Nearly every cell in a personâ€™s body has the same DNA.he structure of the double helix is somewhat like a ladder, with the base pairs forming the ladderâ€™s rungs and the sugar and phosphate molecules forming the vertical sidepieces of the ladder. An important property of DNA is that it can replicate, or make copies of itself.

"]
answer: Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) is a nucleic acid containing genetic instructions used in the development and functioning of organisms. It is made up of nucleotides with four types of nitrogen bases (adenine, thymine, guanine, cytosine), and it forms a double helix structure.
ground_truth: DNA, or Deoxyribonucleic acid, is a nucleic acid that contains the genetic instructions used in the development and functioning of all known living organisms and some viruses. It is made up of molecules called nucleotides, which include a phosphate group, a sugar group, and a nitrogen base. The four types of nitrogen bases are adenine, thymine, guanine, and cytosine. The order of these bases determines the genetic code. DNA is structured like a double helix, similar to a ladder with base pairs forming the rungs and the sugar and phosphate molecules forming the vertical sidepieces. An important attribute of DNA is its ability to replicate, or make copies of itself.

question: how to grill a porterhouse
contexts:
['passage 1:1 Dump a chimney of lit coals into the grill. 2  With a grill hoe or garden hoe, spread the coals into a double layer at the far side and a single layer in the center. 3  Leave the section closest to you coal-free. 4  Replace the grill grate. 5  If using a gas grill, set it up for three-zone grilling.

passage 2:1 Leave the section closest to you coal-free. 2  Replace the grill grate. 3  If using a gas grill, set it up for three-zone grilling. 4  Keep it hot, keep it clean, keep it lubricated: When the grill grate is hot, clean it with a grill brush, then lubricate it with a grill oiler or a folded paper towel dipped in vegetable oil.

passage 3:# 4. The Porterhouse is a manâ€™s steak if there ever was one. Itâ€™s basically two steaks in one the NY Strip on one side of the bone and the filet on the other. The bone gives both cuts tremendous flavor and when cooked just right, you wonâ€™t find a better steak.

']
answer:
1. Preheat your grill for three-zone cooking (high heat on one side, medium on the other, and low on the third).
2. Season the Porterhouse steak with salt and pepper.
3. Place the steak on the hot zone of the grill.
4. Cook for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare (adjust time according to desired doneness).
5. Move the steak to the medium heat zone and continue cooking, flipping occasionally, until desired doneness is reached.
6. Once done, let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
7. Keep the grill grate hot, clean, and lubricated as described in passage 2.
ground_truth: To grill a porterhouse, start by dumping a chimney of lit coals into the grill. Spread the coals into a double layer at the far side and a single layer in the center, leaving the section closest to you coal-free. Replace the grill grate. If using a gas grill, set it up for three-zone grilling. Ensure that the grill is hot, clean, and lubricated. To do this, clean the grill grate with a grill brush once it's hot, then lubricate it with a grill oiler or a folded paper towel dipped in vegetable oil.

question: how to fix a door that won't lock
contexts:
["passage 1:Door Lock & Key Problems. Expert advice on how to repair problems with stuck or frozen door locks, keys that donâ€™t work, and latches that donâ€™t latch. Many door knob and lockset problems can be corrected before they become so serious that the lockset does not work at all.oor Lock & Key Problems. Door latches and locks are somewhat complex pieces of hardware with several working parts that can go wrong and cause them to be unworkable or balky. For helpful do-it-yourself repair techniques for fixing common lock and latch problems, please see How to Repair Door Locks.

passage 2:2. Shut the door and try to lock it. If it won't lock open the door. Tap the end of a chisel under the door stop on the striker side of the jamb. Pry up on it until it comes loose and remove it. Use the chisel to remove the door stop on top as well.lace the door stop back on the jamb. Set it back 1/4 inch from it's original location. You should see a distinct line in the paint, stain or varnish where it came off. Use this to align the door stop. Nail the side and top piece of door stop back on. The door should now shut and lock normally.

passage 3:Close-up. You may also have to enlarge the latch hole in the jamb. Tighten the hinges first. Enlarge the strike plate hole. Move the strike plate. When a door latch wonâ€™t catch, Itâ€™s because the latch doesnâ€™t align with the hole in the strike plate.Sometimes you can clearly see the misalignment. If not, do the â€œlipstick testâ€\x9d (Photo 1). If you find that the latch contacts the strike plate too high or too low, make sure all the doorâ€™s hinge screws are tight.lose-up. You may also have to enlarge the latch hole in the jamb. Tighten the hinges first. Enlarge the strike plate hole. Move the strike plate. When a door latch wonâ€™t catch, Itâ€™s because the latch doesnâ€™t align with the hole in the strike plate.

"]
answer:
Fix a door that won't lock by following these steps:

1. Shut the door and try to lock it. If it won't lock, open the door.
2. Tap the end of a chisel under the door stop on the striker side of the jamb and pry up on it until it comes loose. Remove the door stop from both the top and bottom.
3. Replace the door stop back on the jamb, setting it 1/4 inch from its original location.
4. If necessary, enlarge the latch hole in the jamb and move the strike plate to align with the latch. Tighten all hinge screws before making adjustments.
ground_truth: To fix a door that won't lock, first try to align the door latch with the hole in the strike plate. If the latch is misaligned, you can perform a lipstick test to see where the latch contacts the strike plate. If it contacts too high or too low, tighten all the door's hinge screws. You may also need to enlarge the latch hole in the jamb or move the strike plate. If this doesn't work, shut the door and try to lock it. If it won't lock, tap the end of a chisel under the door stop on the striker side of the jamb, pry it up until it comes loose and remove it. Replace the door stop back on the jamb, set back 1/4 inch from its original location. Nail the side and top piece of the door stop back on. The door should now shut and lock normally.

question: how to cook pollock?
contexts:
['passage 1:1 Spray a baking sheet with butter flavored cooking spray. 2  Season the pollock fillets with paprika and black pepper. 3  Place on baking sheet and layer with onion, green pepper, and tomato slices. 4  Bake in preheated oven until fish has cooked and flakes easily, about 15 minutes.

passage 2:Ready In. 1  Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 2  Season the pollock fillets with paprika and black pepper. 3  Bake in preheated oven until fish has cooked and flakes easily, about 15 minutes.

passage 3:1 Bake in preheated oven until fish has cooked and flakes easily, about 15 minutes. 2  Turn oven off, place two slices of cheese on each fillet. 3  Return fish to the oven and allow cheese to melt, about 3 minutes.

']
answer:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2. Season pollock fillets with paprika and black pepper.
3. Layer onion, green pepper, and tomato slices on the fillets.
4. Bake in preheated oven until fish has cooked and flakes easily, about 15 minutes. (Optional: Add step 2 from passage 3 to melt cheese on top for an additional 3 minutes after preheating is done.)
ground_truth: To cook pollock, first preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with butter flavored cooking spray. Season the pollock fillets with paprika and black pepper and place them on the baking sheet. Layer the fillets with onion, green pepper, and tomato slices. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish has cooked and flakes easily, which should take about 15 minutes. If desired, turn the oven off, place two slices of cheese on each fillet and return fish to the oven to allow cheese to melt for about 3 minutes.

answer:
1. Run the dryer on a regular setting for 20 minutes to soften the plastic.
2. Scrape the plastic off with a wooden or plastic spatula or paint scraper, taking care not to damage the dryer's interior.
3. Apply 1 to 2 tsp. nail polish remover to a clean cloth, and rub the plastic to dissolve it.
4. Rub the area with a damp cloth to rinse the nail polish remover.
5. Mix 1 tsp. liquid laundry soap with 1 cup water. Dip a clean cloth in this solution, and rub the area again.
6. Rinse well with a cloth dipped in clean water.
ground_truth: To get plastic out of a clothes dryer, you can run the dryer on a regular setting for 20 minutes to soften the plastic, then scrape it off with a wooden or plastic spatula or paint scraper. Be careful not to damage the dryer's interior. You can then apply 1 to 2 tsp. of nail polish remover to a clean cloth, and rub the plastic to dissolve it. Afterward, rub the area with a damp cloth to rinse the nail polish remover. You can mix 1 tsp. of liquid laundry soap with 1 cup water, dip a clean cloth in this solution, and rub the area again. Rinse well with a cloth dipped in clean water. Some plastic may be extremely difficult to remove, in which case you can try heating the plastic with a hair dryer or heat gun and then peel it off. If not all plastic comes off, you may need to replace the drum or the entire dryer.

Based on the given passages, here's a step-by-step guide on how to remove plastic from a clothes dryer:

1. Run the dryer on a regular setting for 20 minutes to soften the plastic.
2. Scrape the plastic off with a wooden or plastic spatula or paint scraper, taking care not to damage the dryer's interior.

Therefore, the answer to the question of how to get plastic out of clothes dryer is:

1. Run the dryer on a regular setting for 20 minutes to soften the plastic.
2. Scrape the plastic off with a wooden or plastic spatula or paint scraper.
3. Apply nail polish remover to dissolve the plastic.
4. Rinse with a damp cloth and soap solution.
5. Use a hair dryer or heat gun to heat the plastic if necessary.

If the plastic still does not come off, consider replacing the drum or the entire dryer.

question: how to fold a quilt
contexts:
['passage 1:Begin Sewing Binding to the Quilt Use my step-by-step instructions to learn how to sew mitered binding to the edges of a quilt. Trim the quilt sandwich to remove excess batting and backing. If the quilt top is skewed, fold back the other two layers and use a rotary ruler to very carefully square up the quilt.

passage 2:The Timepiece Quilt used in this tutorial measures 56 inches by 70 inches, but this method can be used on any size quilt. 1  Step 1: Lay your quilt on a bed, table or other flat surface. 2  Step 2: Fold the lower right corner up toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias.

passage 3:Step 3: Fold the lower left corner up toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias. Step 4: Fold the top left corner down toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias. Step 5: Making sure the fold is on the bias, fold the top right corner down toward the center of the quilt.

']
answer:
1. Fold the lower right corner up toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias.
2. Fold the lower left corner up toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias.
3. Fold the top left corner down toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias.
4. Fold the top right corner down toward the center of the quilt making sure the fold is on the bias.
ground_truth: To fold a quilt, you should start by laying your quilt on a flat surface. Then, fold the lower right corner up toward the center of the quilt, making sure the fold is on the bias. Next, fold the lower left corner up toward the center of the quilt, also ensuring the fold is on the bias. Follow this by folding the top left corner down toward the center of the quilt, again making sure the fold is on the bias. Finally, fold the top right corner down toward the center of the quilt, ensuring the fold is on the bias.

question: benefits of a water pick
contexts:
["passage 1:What is that picture above you might ask yourself?? Well, it is a water pik. Most people are very unfamiliar with what a water pik is so I am here to educate you all on it. Water pik's are a great oral care tool that can help you to keep your teeth, gums, mouth, and overall body healthier. A water pik is designed to shoot a strong stream of water at your gum line to help eliminate those pesky germs and plaque that is tough to get rid of with a toothbrush.

passage 2:If youâ€™re sizing up Waterpik vs. Flossing and wondering which one your dentist would recommend, which one is easier, and which one leaves your mouth feeling cleaner, you probably think the Waterpik would win hands down. But does the device really offer all of the benefits it claims it does, and can it beat out the old standby of flossing?

passage 3:A Water Pik is useful in helping to maintain good oral health. It can massage and stimulate soft tissue in the mouth which helps to reduce the risk of gingivitis. Water Pik also helps to clean better around the teeth and gums, removing food from areas areas that brushing can not access.

"]
answer:
1. Eliminates pesky germs and plaque that are tough to get rid of with a toothbrush.
2. Helps maintain good oral health by massaging and stimulating soft tissue in the mouth, reducing the risk of gingivitis.
3. Cleans better around teeth and gums, removing food from areas that brushing can't access.
ground_truth: A water pick, also known as a Waterpik, is a beneficial tool for oral care. It is designed to shoot a strong stream of water at the gum line to help eliminate germs and plaque that are tough to get rid of with a toothbrush. It can also help maintain overall body health. In comparison to flossing, using a water pick can be easier and leave your mouth feeling cleaner. It can also massage and stimulate soft tissue in the mouth, reducing the risk of gingivitis. It is especially useful in cleaning around the teeth and gums, removing food from areas that brushing cannot reach.

question: benefits of a water pick
contexts:
["passage 1:What is that picture above you might ask yourself?? Well, it is a water pik. Most people are very unfamiliar with what a water pik is so I am here to educate you all on it. Water pik's are a great oral care tool that can help you to keep your teeth, gums, mouth, and overall body healthier. A water pik is designed to shoot a strong stream of water at your gum line to help eliminate those pesky germs and plaque that is tough to get rid of with a toothbrush.

passage 2:If youâ€™re sizing up Waterpik vs. Flossing and wondering which one your dentist would recommend, which one is easier, and which one leaves your mouth feeling cleaner, you probably think the Waterpik would win hands down. But does the device really offer all of the benefits it claims it does, and can it beat out the old standby of flossing?

passage 3:A Water Pik is useful in helping to maintain good oral health. It can massage and stimulate soft tissue in the mouth which helps to reduce the risk of gingivitis. Water Pik also helps to clean better around the teeth and gums, removing food from areas areas that brushing can not access.

"]
answer:
1. Eliminates pesky germs and plaque that is tough to get rid of with a toothbrush.
2. Helps maintain good oral health by massaging and stimulating soft tissue in the mouth, reducing the risk of gingivitis.
3. Cleans better around teeth and gums, removing food from areas brushing can't access.
ground_truth: A water pick has several benefits, according to the given passages. It can help eliminate germs and plaque that are difficult to remove with a toothbrush. It can also massage and stimulate soft tissue in the mouth, reducing the risk of gingivitis. Additionally, a water pick can clean better around the teeth and gums, reaching areas that brushing may not be able to access.

question: how can i keep birds from building a nest on my porch
contexts:
["passage 1:4. Attach bird netting to the eves around the perimeter of your porch with a staple gun. If your porch has open rafters, use the staple gun to attach the netting to the top of the porch. The netting keeps the birds from reaching those spaces they often choose to build their nests.ird nests can block your ventilation systems, are made from flammable materials, and bird droppings can transmit disease. You can keep birds from nesting on your porch with different products designed to scare birds away from your property.

passage 2:1. Install bird netting over the top of the light fixture to block the birds' access to it. Choose a netting that is nonflammable and safe to use around light bulbs. Beware that the netting is installed so that it doesn't entangle birds. If you can't use netting on your light fixture, try another method.nstall bird netting over the top of the light fixture to block the birds' access to it. Choose a netting that is nonflammable and safe to use around light bulbs. Beware that the netting is installed so that it doesn't entangle birds.

passage 3:1. Mount a plastic hawk on or near your porch. The sight of a predator can scare the birds from the area and keep them from inhabiting your porch. Move the plastic hawk periodically, so the birds do not become accustom to the plastic hawk, rendering it ineffective.ird nests can block your ventilation systems, are made from flammable materials, and bird droppings can transmit disease. You can keep birds from nesting on your porch with different products designed to scare birds away from your property.

"]
answer: Attach bird netting to the eves around the perimeter of your porch, use a staple gun if necessary. If your porch has open rafters, attach the netting to the top of the porch. Alternatively, mount a plastic hawk on or near your porch.
ground_truth: You can prevent birds from building nests on your porch by attaching bird netting to the eves around the perimeter of your porch and the top of the porch if it has open rafters. This will block the birds from reaching spaces they often choose to build their nests. If you have a light fixture, you can also install bird netting over it, but make sure the netting is nonflammable and safe to use around light bulbs and doesn't entangle birds. Another method is to mount a plastic hawk on or near your porch, as this can scare birds away. Remember to move the plastic hawk periodically to prevent the birds from becoming accustomed to it.

question: set default browser to windows
contexts:
['passage 1:How To: Set the Default Web Browser in Windows 7. CMU Help Desk: 970-248-2111 or http://whd.coloradomesa.edu Page 1. This document explains how to set the default web browser in Windows 7. Once set, any hyperlink that is selected. will cause the default browser to open and the address of the link will be retrieved. Decide which browser you. want to be your default and perform the respective steps below for the chosen browser.

passage 2:Method 1 of 2. Step 1: Open Settings app. To do so, open Start menu and then click Settings icon. Alternatively, you can use Windows + I keyboard shortcut to quickly open Settings app. Step 2: Click the first option titled System (display, notifications, apps, power). Step 3: In the left-pane, click Default apps. Step 4: Now, on the right-side, scroll down the page to see Web browser section. Step 5: Click on the Edge browser entry (or any browser other than Chrome) to reveal Choose an app, and then click Google Chrome to set it as default browser.

passage 3:To set Mozilla Firefox as your default Windows browser, take the following steps. 1  Open your Firefox browser. 2  Click on the Firefox menu button, represented by three horizontal lines and located in the upper right hand corner of the browser window. 3  When the pop-out menu appears, select Options.

']
answer: Passage 2 provides steps to set a default browser in Windows 7 using Google Chrome. To set Mozilla Firefox as your default browser, follow the steps provided in passage 3.
ground_truth:
To set the default web browser in Windows, follow these steps: 

1. Open the Settings app. You can do this by opening the Start menu and clicking the Settings icon, or by using the Windows + I keyboard shortcut. 
2. Click the first option titled System (display, notifications, apps, power). 
3. In the left-pane, click Default apps. 
4. On the right-side, scroll down to see the Web browser section. 
5. Click on the current browser entry to reveal Choose an app. 
6. Click the browser you want to set as default. 

These steps are applicable to any browser you want to set as default, including Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.

question: set default browser to windows
contexts:
['passage 1:How To: Set the Default Web Browser in Windows 7. CMU Help Desk: 970-248-2111 or http://whd.coloradomesa.edu Page 1. This document explains how to set the default web browser in Windows 7. Once set, any hyperlink that is selected. will cause the default browser to open and the address of the link will be retrieved. Decide which browser you. want to be your default and perform the respective steps below for the chosen browser.

passage 2:Method 1 of 2. Step 1: Open Settings app. To do so, open Start menu and then click Settings icon. Alternatively, you can use Windows + I keyboard shortcut to quickly open Settings app. Step 2: Click the first option titled System (display, notifications, apps, power). Step 3: In the left-pane, click Default apps. Step 4: Now, on the right-side, scroll down the page to see Web browser section. Step 5: Click on the Edge browser entry (or any browser other than Chrome) to reveal Choose an app, and then click Google Chrome to set it as default browser.

passage 3:To set Mozilla Firefox as your default Windows browser, take the following steps. 1  Open your Firefox browser. 2  Click on the Firefox menu button, represented by three horizontal lines and located in the upper right hand corner of the browser window. 3  When the pop-out menu appears, select Options.

']
answer: To set the default browser to Windows (Chrome or Edge), follow the steps mentioned in passage 2. If you want to set Mozilla Firefox as your default browser, use the steps provided in passage 3.
ground_truth:
Sure, I can help you with that! Based on the given passages, here are the steps to set the default browser to Windows:

Method 1:

1. Open the Settings app by clicking the Start menu and then clicking the Settings icon, or by using the Windows + I keyboard shortcut.
2. In the Settings app, click the first option titled System (display, notifications, apps, power).
3. In the left-pane, click Default apps.
4. On the right-side, scroll down the page to see Web browser section.
5. Click on the Edge browser entry (or any browser other than Chrome) to reveal Choose an app, and then click Google Chrome to set it as default browser.

Alternatively, you can also set Mozilla Firefox as your default Windows browser by following these steps:

1. Open your Firefox browser.
2. Click on the Firefox menu button, represented by three horizontal lines and located in the upper right-hand corner of the browser window.
3. When the pop-out menu appears, select Options.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

question: what is the proper way to dispose of a worn usa flag
contexts:
['passage 1:Disposal of a faded or worn American flag is to be done in one of three ways. You can, if necessary, put the flag out for collection only after you have removed the blue field from the flag. The blue field is to be burned in a peaceful manner and the ashes buried.

passage 2:â€œThis Flag has served its nation long and well. It has worn to a condition to which it should no longer be used to represent the nation. This Flag represents all of the Flags collected and being retired from service today. We honor them all as we salute one Flag.â€\x9d.

passage 3:The other method is to burn the flag yourself in a proper ceremony. If you are able to personally discharge your worn flag from service the ceremony that follows is the proper way. The flag must be folded in the customary triangle fold.

']
answer:
The proper ways to dispose of a worn USA flag are:
1. Putting it out for collection after removing the blue field, which should then be burned and the ashes buried.
2. Burning the flag yourself in a proper ceremony, folding it in the customary triangle fold beforehand.
ground_truth: The proper way to dispose of a worn USA flag is either by separating the blue field from the flag and burning it in a peaceful manner before burying the ashes, or by conducting a proper ceremony where the flag is folded in the customary triangle fold and then burned.

passage 2:â€œThis Flag has served its nation long and well. It has worn to a condition to which it should no longer be used to represent the nation. This Flag represents all of the Flags collected and being retired from service today. We honor them all as we salute one Flag.â€\x9d.

passage 3:The other method is to burn the flag yourself in a proper ceremony. If you are able to personally discharge your worn flag from service the ceremony that follows is the proper way. The flag must be folded in the customary triangle fold.

']
answer:
The proper ways to dispose of a worn USA flag are:
1. Putting it out for collection after removing the blue field, which should then be burned and the ashes buried.
2. Burning the flag yourself in a proper ceremony. If you choose this method, the flag must be folded in the customary triangle fold.
ground_truth: Based on the given passages, the proper way to dispose of a worn USA flag is either by putting it out for collection after removing the blue field, burning it in a peaceful manner and burying the ashes or by burning it oneself in a proper ceremony while folding it in the customary triangle fold.

question: how to cook brats
contexts:
['passage 1:1 Reduce heat to medium and cook another 10 to 12 minutes. 2  Remove the bratwurst from the beer mixture; reduce heat to low, and continue cooking the onions. 3  Cook the bratwurst on the preheated grill, turning once, 5 to 10 minutes. 4  Serve with the beer mixture as a topping or side.irections. Prep. Cook. Ready In. 1  Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. 2  When hot, lightly oil grate. 3  Combine the beer and onions in a large pot; bring to a boil. 4  Submerge the bratwurst in the beer; add the red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

passage 2:1 Prick bratwurst with fork to prevent them from exploding as they cook. 2  Place in a large stock pot with the onions, butter, and beer. 3  Place pot over medium heat, and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.4  Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place pot over medium heat, and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. 2  Preheat grill for medium-high heat. 3  Lightly oil grate. 4  Cook bratwurst on preheated grill for 10 to 14 minutes, turning occasionally to brown evenly.

passage 3:Add the onions. Brown the onions in the butter for 1-2 minutes. Stir them frequently to make sure they are browned on all sides. 1  Some recipes suggest cooking the onions after you cook the bratwurst, so that you can monitor the bratwurst more effectively and so that you donâ€™t risk overcooking the onions.ooked bratwurst can last for about 5 days in the fridge. You can also store cooked bratwurst in the freezer for up to 3 months in the freezer. Write the date that you stored it on the container so that you can keep track of its expiration date. 1  Cook up a large batch of bratwurst and freeze it.

']
answer:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Lightly oil the grate.
2. Combine beer, onions, butter in a large pot; bring to a boil. Submerge the bratwurst, add red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
3. Prick bratwurst with a fork. Cook on preheated grill for 10-14 minutes, turning occasionally to brown evenly.
4. Serve with the beer mixture as a topping or side.
ground_truth:
Based on the passages provided, the steps to cook brats are as follows:

1. Prick the bratwurst with a fork to prevent them from exploding as they cook. 
2. Combine beer and onions in a large pot and bring it to a boil. Submerge the bratwurst in the beer, adding red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the pot over medium heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
4. In the meantime, preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
5. After simmering, remove the bratwurst from the beer mixture and reduce the heat to low, continuing to cook the onions.
6. Cook the bratwurst on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, for about 10 to 14 minutes until they are browned evenly.
7. Serve the bratwurst with the beer and onion mixture as a topping or side.

1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Lightly oil the grate.
2. Combine beer, onions, butter in a large pot; bring to a boil. Submerge the bratwurst, add red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.

Based on the given passages, here is how to cook brats:

Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat.

Step 2: Lightly oil the grate.

Step 3: Combine beer and onions in a large pot, bring to a boil, and submerge the bratwurst. Add red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

Step 4: Simmer the bratwurst in the beer mixture for 10 to 14 minutes, turning occasionally to brown evenly.

Step 5: Remove the bratwurst from the beer mixture and grill it on the preheated grill for an additional 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through.

Step 6: Serve the bratwurst with the beer mixture as a topping or side dish.

Note: It's important to prick the bratwurst with a fork before cooking to prevent them from exploding while cooking. Also, cooked bratwurst can be stored in the fridge for up to 5 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat.
2. Lightly oil the grate.
3. Combine beer, onions, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large pot. Bring to a boil.

question: symptoms and causes of ibs
contexts:
['passage 1:The cause of irritable bowel syndrome is currently unknown. It is thought to result from a combination of abnormal gastrointestinal (GI) tract movements, increased awareness of bodily functions, and a disruption in the communication between the brain and the GI tract. IBS-D is irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea.

passage 2:The exact cause of irritable bowel syndrome is unknown. It is believed to be due to a number of factors, including alteration in the gastrointestinal (GI) tract motility, abnormal nervous system signals, increased sensitivity to pain, and food intolerances. The following are risk factors thought to cause IBS: 1  Abnormal movements of the colon and small intestines (too fast or slow, or too strong) 2  Hypersensitivity to pain from a full bowel or gas. 3  Food sensitivities, possibly caused by poor absorption of sugars or acids in food.

passage 3:People with IBS have symptoms that can include: 1  Diarrhea (often described as violent episodes of diarrhea) 2  Constipation. 3  Constipation alternating with diarrhea.  Belly pains or cramps, usually in the lower half of the belly, that get worse after meals and feel better after a bowel 1  movement. A lot of gas or bloating.

']
answer:
Symptoms: Diarrhea, constipation, alternating diarrhea and constipation, belly pains or cramps, gas, bloating.
   Causes: Abnormal movements of the colon and small intestines, hypersensitivity to pain, food sensitivities, alterations in GI tract motility, abnormal nervous system signals.
ground_truth: The cause of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is unknown. However, it is believed to be a result of abnormal gastrointestinal (GI) tract movements, increased awareness of bodily functions, disruption in communication between the brain and the GI tract, abnormal nervous system signals, increased sensitivity to pain, and food intolerances. Risk factors may include abnormal movements of the colon and small intestines (either too fast or slow, or too strong), hypersensitivity to pain from a full bowel or gas, and food sensitivities possibly caused by poor absorption of sugars or acids in food. Symptoms of IBS can include diarrhea, constipation, or alternating between the two, belly pains or cramps that worsen after meals and feel better after a bowel movement, as well as a lot of gas or bloating.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here are the symptoms and causes of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS):

Symptoms:

* Diarrhea (often described as violent episodes of diarrhea)
* Constipation
* Constipation alternating with diarrhea
* Belly pains or cramps, usually in the lower half of the belly, that get worse after meals and feel better after a bowel movement
* A lot of gas or bloating

Causes:

* Abnormal movements of the colon and small intestines (too fast or slow, or too strong)
* Hypersensitivity to pain from a full bowel or gas
* Food sensitivities, possibly caused by poor absorption of sugars or acids in food
* Disruption in the communication between the brain and the gastrointestinal (GI) tract
* Alteration in the gastrointestinal (GI) tract motility
* Abnormal nervous system signals

Note that the exact cause of IBS is unknown, and it is believed to be due to a combination of these factors.

question: how to prepare blood slide
contexts:
["passage 1:If you'd like to see red blood cells, you'll need to learn how to do a Blood Smear. Everything is simple except pricking your finger! Level: Adult supervision (Perhaps for a blood donation too, unless someone has a boo-boo!). Materials: Slide, cover slip, needle, matches or lighter. First sterilize the needle with a flame.

passage 2:Blood can carry diseases that can be transferred from person to person. One should always avoid coming into contact with another person's blood. If it is unavoidable, one should wear rubber gloves. Put a drop of blood toward one end of a slide.

passage 3:How to Make a Blood Smear STEP ONE: Place clean glass slide on a flat surface. Add one small drop of blood to one end. STEP TWO: Take another clean slide, and holding at an angle of about 45 deg, touch the blood with one end of the slide so the blood runs along the edge of the slide by capillary action. Push carefully along the length of the first slide to produce a thin smear of blood. STEP THREE: Make 2 smears, allow to air dry, and label clearly. Once dried place in the provided slide transport containers.

"]
answer:
1. Sterilize a needle with flame.
   2. Place a clean glass slide on a flat surface.
   3. Add one small drop of blood to one end of the slide.
   4. Take another clean slide, holding it at an angle of about 45 degrees, touch the blood with one end of the slide so the blood runs along the edge by capillary action.
   5. Push carefully along the length of the first slide to produce a thin smear of blood.
   6. Make 2 smears, allow to air dry, and label clearly. Once dried, place in the provided slide transport containers.
ground_truth: To prepare a blood slide, first sterilize a needle with a flame. Place a clean glass slide on a flat surface and add a small drop of blood to one end. Then, take another clean slide and holding it at an angle of about 45 degrees, touch the blood with one end of the slide so that the blood runs along the edge of the slide by capillary action. Push carefully along the length of the first slide to produce a thin smear of blood. Make two smears, allow them to air dry and label clearly. Once dried, place them in the provided slide transport containers. Always avoid coming into contact with another person's blood and if it is unavoidable, wear rubber gloves.

question: what is the difference between essential and nonessential amino acids
contexts:
["passage 1:Nine out of the 20 amino acids are essential, but adults only need to obtain eight of them: valine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine and tryptophan.The ninth amino acid -- histidine -- is only essential for infants.ine out of the 20 amino acids are essential, but adults only need to obtain eight of them: valine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine and tryptophan.

passage 2:Don't think of nonessential amino acids as being unnecessary.. Your body is able to make some amino acids if you don't get them from your diet. Your body creates them from essential amino acids or by breaking down protein products -- thus they are not essential to obtain from your diet.These acids include alanine, asparagine, aspartic acid, glutamic acid, arginine, cysteine, glutamine, glycine, ornithine, proline, serine and tyrosine.our body creates them from essential amino acids or by breaking down protein products -- thus they are not essential to obtain from your diet. These acids include alanine, asparagine, aspartic acid, glutamic acid, arginine, cysteine, glutamine, glycine, ornithine, proline, serine and tyrosine.

passage 3:Amino acids are the basic building blocks of proteins. answer: Essential amino acids cannot be produced by the body and must be obtained from the diet, while nonessential amino acids can be synthesized by the body.
ground_truth: Essential amino acids are ones that the body cannot produce on its own, thus they must be obtained through diet. In adults, there are eight essential amino acids: valine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine, and tryptophan. For infants, histidine is also considered essential. On the other hand, nonessential amino acids are those that the body can produce, even if they are not present in the diet. These include alanine, asparagine, aspartic acid, glutamic acid, arginine, cysteine, glutamine, glycine, ornithine, proline, serine, and tyrosine. While not essential to obtain from diet, these amino acids are still necessary as they are used by the body to build proteins needed for cell repair, growth, and maintenance.

question: how to sync audiobook from iphone to itunes
contexts:
["passage 1:How to transfer audiobooks to an iPhone, iPad, or iPod using OverDrive for Windows. You can transfer audiobooks from your computer to your Apple device (iPhone, iPad, or iPod) using OverDrive for Windows (desktop) . In iTunes, turn on the Manually manage music setting. 2  This is a one-time step that is required to transfer audiobooks to your Apple device from OverDrive for Windows. 3  If you'd prefer to import an MP3 audiobook into your iTunes library directly so you can sync it to your device, follow these instructions instead.

passage 2:Instructions. Download the audiobook you want from iTunes. Click on â€œAudiobooksâ€\x9d on the left task pane of the iTunes window. You should see your downloaded audiobook there.Click the box next to the title of the book to make a check mark next to it. Connect your iPhone to the USB cable and plug the other end of the USB cable into a USB port on the computer. Wait for iTunes to sync.After the sync is complete, the audiobook will be on your iPhone.nstructions. Download the audiobook you want from iTunes. Click on â€œAudiobooksâ€\x9d on the left task pane of the iTunes window. You should see your downloaded audiobook there.

passage 3:Step 1: Launch iTunes on your computer, and then connect iPod/iPad/iPhone to PC. Step 2: Click the name of your iPhone/iPod/iPod under Devices in the left column. Step 3: Choose Books above the main iTunes window. Step 4: Select audiobooks you want to transfer.*Click Sync Audiobooks and then choose the audiobooks you want to transfer or select All Audiobooks to transfer all of them to the iPhone/iPod/iPad. Click Apply at the bottom of the screen, you can finish syncing process.) Click Import, you can add new audiobooks from PC to your iOS devices. Syncios Audiobook Transfer is a two ways transfer for all files, so you can not only backup files to PC, transfer audiobooks from PC to your iPod/iPhone/iPad is also available.

"]
answer:
To sync an audiobook from iPhone to iTunes, follow these steps:

1. Connect your iPhone to the computer running iTunes.
2. In iTunes, click on your iPhone's name under Devices in the left column.
3. Choose Books above the main iTunes window.
4. Select the audiobooks you want to sync from the list.
5. Click Sync Audiobooks and then choose the audiobooks you want to transfer or select All Audiobooks to transfer all of them to your computer.
6. Click Apply at the bottom of the screen, you can finish syncing process.
ground_truth: To sync an audiobook from your iPhone to iTunes, first download the audiobook you want from iTunes and click on â€œAudiobooksâ€ on the left task pane of the iTunes window. You should see your downloaded audiobook there. Connect your iPhone to your computer using the USB cable. Wait for iTunes to sync. After the sync is complete, the audiobook will be on your iPhone. You can also manually manage music settings in iTunes and use OverDrive for Windows to transfer audiobooks from your computer to your iPhone. If you'd prefer to import an MP3 audiobook into your iTunes library directly so you can sync it to your device, you can follow these instructions as well.

To sync an audiobook from an iPhone to iTunes, you can follow these steps:
1. Launch iTunes on your computer.
2. Connect your iPhone to the computer using a USB cable.
3. In iTunes, click on the name of your iPhone under the Devices section.
4. Select "Books" above the main iTunes window.
5. Choose the audiobooks you want to transfer by clicking on them.

8. After the sync is complete, the audiobooks will be transferred from your iPhone to iTunes.

2. Download the audiobook you want from iTunes.

Here are the steps to use Syncios Audiobook Transfer:

1. Launch Syncios Audiobook Transfer on your computer.
2. Connect your iPhone to the computer via USB cable.
3. Click on "Audiobooks" on the top menu bar.
4. Select the audiobooks you want to transfer and click "Export" to save them to your computer.
5. Alternatively, you can also click "Import" to add new audiobooks from your computer to your iPhone.
6. Click "Apply" to start the transfer process.

Note that the above steps are based on the assumption that you have already turned on the Manually manage music setting in iTunes. If you have not done so, you will need to do so before attempting to sync your audiobooks.

question: how the body systems work together
contexts:
['passage 1:The Systems. Several systems in the human body work together to help keep it functioning normally. These systems are the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, urinary, endocrine, lymphatic, immune, reproductive and the nervous.

passage 2:The urinary system also works closely with all other systems of the body. It is used to clean blood from the body. This system cleans waste products from the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory and nervous systems. The system includes the kidneys and lower intestines.

passage 3:The respiratory system also works closely with all other systems of the body. The respiratory system provides oxygen for all body parts. It also removes carbon dioxide from the muscular, digestive, skeletal, circulatory, urinary and nervous systems. This system includes the nose, larynx, trachea and the lungs.

']
answer: The body systems work together by exchanging substances and performing various functions to maintain a balanced internal environment. For example, the respiratory system provides oxygen for all body parts while removing carbon dioxide, which is then processed by the circulatory system. Waste products from the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, and nervous systems are cleaned by the urinary system. The endocrine system regulates hormones that affect various bodily functions, while the immune system protects the body against foreign substances and diseases.
ground_truth: The various systems in the human body work together to ensure its normal functioning. For instance, the urinary system works with all other systems to clean the blood by removing waste products from the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, and nervous systems. This includes organs like the kidneys and lower intestines. Similarly, the respiratory system also collaborates with all other systems to provide oxygen to all body parts and remove carbon dioxide from the muscular, digestive, skeletal, circulatory, urinary, and nervous systems. The respiratory system comprises the nose, larynx, trachea, and lungs.

question: how the body systems work together
contexts:
['passage 1:The Systems. Several systems in the human body work together to help keep it functioning normally. These systems are the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, urinary, endocrine, lymphatic, immune, reproductive and the nervous.

passage 2:The urinary system also works closely with all other systems of the body. It is used to clean blood from the body. This system cleans waste products from the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory and nervous systems. The system includes the kidneys and lower intestines.

passage 3:The respiratory system also works closely with all other systems of the body. The respiratory system provides oxygen for all body parts. It also removes carbon dioxide from the muscular, digestive, skeletal, circulatory, urinary and nervous systems. This system includes the nose, larynx, trachea and the lungs.

']
answer: The body systems work together by exchanging nutrients, waste products, gases, and signals to maintain homeostasis (balance). Each system has a specific function but they all interact and depend on each other for proper functioning. For example, the respiratory system provides oxygen to all body parts, while the circulatory system carries this oxygen to every cell. The digestive system breaks down food for energy and nutrients, which are then used by the muscular, skeletal, and other systems. Waste products from these systems are removed by the urinary system, among others. The nervous system coordinates all activities and responses in the body.
ground_truth:
Based on the provided passages, here's how the body systems work together:

1. The skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, urinary, endocrine, lymphatic, immune, and nervous systems all work together to help keep the body functioning normally. (Passage 1)
2. The urinary system works closely with all other systems of the body to clean blood from the body and remove waste products from the skeletal, muscular, digestive, respiratory, circulatory, and nervous systems. (Passage 2)
3. The respiratory system provides oxygen for all body parts and removes carbon dioxide from the muscular, digestive, skeletal, circulatory, urinary, and nervous systems. (Passage 3)

Therefore, the body systems work together in the following ways:

* The skeletal system provides support and structure for the body, while the muscular system helps move the body and its parts.
* The digestive system breaks down food into nutrients that can be absorbed and used by the body, while the respiratory system provides oxygen for energy production.
* The circulatory system delivers oxygenated blood to the body's cells and removes carbon dioxide, while the urinary system removes waste products from the blood.
* The endocrine system produces hormones that regulate various bodily functions, including growth and development, metabolism, and reproductive processes.
* The lymphatic system helps defend the body against infection and disease, while the immune system fights off foreign invaders.
* The nervous system controls and coordinates the body's functions, including movement, sensation, and thought processes.

Overall, the body's systems work together in a complex interplay to maintain homeostasis and ensure the proper functioning of the body.

passage 2:The following steps are required to transfer a Water Stock Certificate: 1  Seller must return the Water Stock Certificate that was assigned to them and sign the back of the certificate. 2  The new owner of the property must provide proof of ownership. 3  A fee of $75.00 must be paid to process a Water Stock Certificate transfer. 4  A new Water Stock 5  ... An ...

passage 3:Buying a home with water shares or rights can be exciting but sometimes stressful if you do not have all the information. This article will help buyer and sellers better understand how to deal with water when purchasing or selling a home. There are 3 types of water rights in the state of Utah. If your home has water rights or shares you will want to understand the steps it will take to transfer the water rights into your name.

']
answer:
Water shares are transferred by following these steps:
   1. The seller must return the Water Stock Certificate assigned to them and sign the back of the certificate.
   2. The new owner of the property must provide proof of ownership.
   3. A fee of $75.00 must be paid to process a Water Stock Certificate transfer.
   4. A new Water Stock Certificate will be issued to the new owner of record.
ground_truth: To transfer water shares, the seller must return the Water Stock Certificate that was assigned to them and sign the back of it. The new owner of the property must provide proof of ownership. A fee of $75.00 must be paid to process a Water Stock Certificate transfer. After these steps, a new Water Stock Certificate will be issued to the new owner. If the original certificate is lost, an additional fee of $75.00 must be paid when filing a Lost Certificate Affidavit form, which is furnished by the Company and must be signed and notarized.

question: building a lean-to shed
contexts:
['passage 1:Lean To Shed Plans â€“ Step By Step Instructions For Building A Lean-To Shed. 1. Prepare the site with a 4â€³ layer of compacted gravel. Cut the two 4 x 4 skids at 70 2/4â€³. Set and level the skids following the shed building plans. Cut two 2 x 6 rim joists at 7 3/4 â€\x9d and six joists at 44 3/4â€³. Assemble the floor and set it on the skids as shown in the floor framing section of the lean to shed plans. Check for square, and then anchor the frame to the skids with four joist clip angles.

passage 2:Cut two pressure-treated 4 by 4s to a length of 6 feet for the skids. Position the frame on the skids, and, when square, toenail the floor joists to the skids. Attach 3/4-inch tongue-and-groove plywood flooring onto the frame. 2he walls for the shed are constructed separately and then raised onto the frame.

passage 3:Building the Shed. The shed shown here is 6 feet long by 4 feet wide. You can easily expand its dimensions in increments of 2 or 4 feet. 1To construct the framing for the shedâ€™s floor, cut two pressure-treated 2 by 4s to a length of 6 feet for the rim joists.

']
answer: In the given passages, it is outlined that you should prepare the site with compacted gravel, cut skids (4x4) and rim joists (2x6), assemble the floor, set it on the skids, check for square, anchor the frame to the skids, then attach plywood flooring. The walls are constructed separately and raised onto the frame. The shed shown is 6 feet long by 4 feet wide.
ground_truth: To build a lean-to shed, start by preparing the site with a 4" layer of compacted gravel. Cut two 4 x 4 skids to a length of 70 2/4" and set and level them according to the shed building plans. Cut two 2 x 6 rim joists at 7 3/4" and six joists at 44 3/4". Assemble the floor and place it on the skids as indicated in the floor framing section of the plans. Check for squareness and anchor the frame to the skids with four joist clip angles. Cut two more 4 x 4s to a length of 6 feet for the skids and, when the frame is square, toenail the floor joists to the skids. Attach 3/4-inch tongue-and-groove plywood flooring onto the frame. The walls for the shed are constructed separately and then raised onto the frame. The size of the shed can be adjusted as needed.

question: difference between vietnam and india
contexts:
["passage 1:So in other words the trends in India are much more typical than are the trends in Vietnam. And the early focus, which was a very appropriate one at the time, was getting children into school in the first place, which meant basically looking at resources and facilities, setting up schools, training teachers and so on.t the same time the education system in Vietnam is relatively equitable and this means that poorer children really get the same deal as those who are better-off than they are. And they are therefore not less advantaged in the school system. AB: Thatâ€™s really interesting.

passage 2:India supported Vietnam's independence from France, opposed American involvement in the Vietnam War, and supported unification of Vietnam. During the Vietnam War, India supported the North, albeit not by conducting military hostilities against the South.he Republic of India and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam enjoy strong bilateral relations. Cultural and economic links between India and Vietnam date back to 2nd century. The Indic ChÄƒm Pa kingdom had some influence on Vietnamese music.

passage 3:France and the United Kingdom, holding some of the largest colonies in the world, were feeling this wave of nationalism, and both suffered colonial loss around the same time. The United Kingdom lost India in 1947, and France lost the colony of Indochina, modern day Vietnam, shortly after World War II in 1945.The two colonies were both the largest of their colonizers at the time and both were economically most contributing.ollowing decolonization both France and left their respective colonies in similar conditions. After The United Kingdom left India the country became divided between the Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs, which resulted in numerous conflicts.

"]
answer:
1. Education Equity: Vietnam's education system is relatively equitable, while India faced issues with educational disparities between socio-economic groups in its early focus on getting children into school.
2. Colonial History: Both countries gained independence from France around the same time (Vietnam post-WWII and India in 1947), but India experienced partition and subsequent conflicts due to religious differences, which Vietnam did not face.
ground_truth: The passages suggest that trends in India are more typical than those in Vietnam, particularly in the area of education. Vietnam's education system is described as relatively equitable, where poorer children receive the same treatment as their better-off counterparts. In contrast, India's early focus was on getting children into school, which involved setting up schools, and training teachers. Politically, India supported Vietnam's independence from France and opposed American involvement in the Vietnam War. Both countries have a history of colonialism, with India being a former colony of the United Kingdom and Vietnam of France. Post-colonization, India experienced division and conflict among Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs. Cultural and economic links between India and Vietnam date back to the 2nd century.

question: how to roast individual garlic cloves
contexts:
["passage 1:1 Garlic roasting time is dependent on the size of your garlic cloves. Note that it may take up to 45 minutes or even an hour for your cloves to soften if they are large.  Store roasted garlic cloves in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.

passage 2:Season the garlic cloves to taste with herbs and spices, if you like. For kick, add some cayenne or chipotle pepper powder, Cajun seasoning mix or curry powder. Dried oregano, marjoram, thyme, rosemary, tarragon or basil work well, too. Choose seasonings to complement the food you're using the roasted garlic with.

passage 3:One or more whole heads of garlic. Method. 1 Preheat your oven to 400Â°F (205Â° C). 2 Peel and discard the papery outer layers of the whole garlic bulb, leaving intact the skins of the individual cloves of garlic. Using a sharp knife, cut 1/4 to a 1/2 inch from the top of cloves, exposing the individual cloves of garlic. 3 Place the garlic heads in a baking pan, cut side up. (A muffin pan works great for this, as it keeps the garlic bulbs from rolling around.) Drizzle a couple teaspoons of olive oil over each exposed head, using your fingers to rub the olive oil over all the cut, exposed garlic cloves.

"]
answer:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (205°C).
2. Peel the papery outer layers of the garlic clove.
3. Cut 1/4 to a 1/2 inch from the top, exposing the individual clove.
4. Place the garlic clove in a baking pan, cut side up.
5. Drizzle a couple teaspoons of olive oil over the exposed garlic clove, using your fingers to rub the olive oil over it.
6. Roast for 20-45 minutes or until softened, depending on the size of the clove.
ground_truth: Preheat your oven to 400Â°F (205Â° C). Peel and discard the papery outer layers of the whole garlic bulb, but keep the skins of the individual cloves intact. Using a sharp knife, cut 1/4 to a 1/2 inch from the top of cloves to expose them. Place the garlic heads in a baking pan, cut side up. Drizzle a couple teaspoons of olive oil over each exposed head, using your fingers to rub the oil over all the cut, exposed garlic cloves. Season the garlic cloves to taste with herbs and spices if you like. Roasting time is dependent on the size of the cloves and may take up to 45 minutes or an hour for larger cloves. Once roasted, the garlic cloves can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.

1. Preheat your oven to 400Â°F (205Â°C).

You can also season the garlic cloves to taste with herbs and spices before roasting.

question: what is the treatment when asset is discarded as per income tax act
contexts:
['passage 1:For the purposes of Income Tax Act, a previous year is a distinct unit. In case an asset is discarded by the business but not sold, section 43(6) permits the scrap value of the asset to be reduced from the block in the previous year in which such asset is discarded.nder the block concept, all the assets falling within the same class and subject to same rate of depreciation are clubbed together and considered as single asset. Any alterations to the value of the block have to be strictly in accordance with the provisions of Chapter IV D of Income Tax Act, 1961.

passage 2:Illustration 4 Note: The purpose of this illustration is to assist in clarifying the meaning of the explanation toparagraph 13 of theStandard. Facts: 1. The income before depreciation and tax of an enterprise for 15 years is Rs. 1000 lakhs per year, both as per the booksof account and for income-tax purposes.2. The enterprise is subject to 100 percent tax-holiday for the first 10 years under section 80-IA.llustration 4 Note: The purpose of this illustration is to assist in clarifying the meaning of the explanation toparagraph 13 of theStandard. Facts: 1. The income before depreciation and tax of an enterprise for 15 years is Rs. 1000 lakhs per year, both as per the booksof account and for income-tax purposes.

passage 3:Pavan Jain S. Depreciation â€“ a non cash expenditure allowed under Income Tax Act, 1961 following block concept. Under the block concept, all the assets falling within the same class and subject to same rate of depreciation are clubbed together and considered as single asset.he assessee is entitled to claim depreciation on the residual value of such discarded asset [ie., Opening WDV of such asset less scrap value] even though such discarded asset is not used for the purposes of business or profession in such year and subsequent years.

']
answer: The treatment when an asset is discarded, as per the Income Tax Act, is that the scrap value of the asset can be reduced from the block in the previous year in which such asset is discarded. The assessee is entitled to claim depreciation on the residual value of such discarded asset.
ground_truth: Based on the Income Tax Act, when an asset is discarded but not sold, the scrap value of the asset can be reduced from the block in the previous year in which the asset is discarded as per section 43(6). This is done under the block concept, where all assets of the same class and subject to the same rate of depreciation are considered as a single asset. Any changes to the block's value must abide by the provisions of Chapter IV D of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Additionally, the assessee can claim depreciation on the residual value of such discarded asset, even if it's not used for the purposes of business or profession in that year and subsequent years.

1. Make a zipper sandwich by placing 1 piece of lining fabric face up, then the zipper and then the outer fabric right side facing down. Line up the three edges.
2. Sew a line near to the seam line on both pieces (zipper and outer fabric) with a zipper foot, securing the position.
3. Place the zipper gusset lining on top of them with right side facing down. Stitch on the seam line.
4. Flip the lining to the bottom of main zipper gusset, top stitch near the seam line.
5. Repeat sewing another side of the zipper gusset.
6. Change the presser foot back to normal foot, stitch on the seam allowance around the zipper gusset so that the main and lining fabric attach together nicely.
ground_truth: To sew a zipper gusset, start by tracing all patterns to the fabric and cutting it out. Start by making a zipper sandwich, which involves placing a piece of lining fabric face up, then the zipper, and then the outer fabric right side facing down. Line up all three edges. Then, using a zipper foot, sew across the top between the edge of your zipper sandwich and the zipper teeth. Repeat this for the other side of the zipper. Pin the zipper gusset to the zipper about 1/4" away from the center with the right sides facing each other. Sew a line near the seam line to secure the position. Place the zipper gusset lining on top of them with the right side facing down and stitch on the seam line. Flip the lining to the bottom of the main zipper gusset and top stitch near the seam line. Repeat on the other side. The width of the zipper between the gussets should measure 1/2". Change the presser foot back to a normal foot and stitch on the seam allowance around the zipper gusset. This should attach the main and lining fabric together nicely. Finally, place the zipper gusset onto the main body of the item you're sewing, aligning the ends to the center markings and sew from marking to marking at both ends. Place the lining on top of them with the right side facing down.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here are the steps to sew a zipper gusset:

1. Make a casing in the side seams by stitching the outer edge of the gusset and the back side seam.
2. Slide the boning right down into the casing.
3. Push the seam allowance to the back and tack the casing to the lining, if necessary, so it doesn't move.
4. Make a zipper sandwich by placing one piece of lining fabric face up, followed by the zipper, and then the outer fabric right side facing down.
5. Sew across the top of the zipper sandwich with a zipper foot, making sure to line up the three edges.
6. Repeat the process for the other side of the zipper.
7. Trace all pattern pieces to the remaining fabric and cut them out.
8. Pin the zipper gusset to the zipper, with the right sides facing each other, and sew a line near the seam line to secure the position.
9. Place the zipper gusset lining on top of the zipper gusset, with the right sides facing down, and stitch along the seam line.
10. Flip the lining to the bottom of the main zipper gusset and top stitch near the seam line.
11. Repeat the process for the other side of the zipper gusset.
12. The width of the zipper between the gusset should measure 1/2".
13. Change the presser foot back to a normal foot and stitch along the seam allowance around the zipper gusset to attach the main and lining fabrics together nicely.

Therefore, to sew a zipper gusset, you need to make a casing in the side seams, insert the boning, make a zipper sandwich, sew the zipper gusset to the zipper, and attach the lining to the zipper gusset.

question: how to bake hard boiled egg
contexts:
["passage 1:Directions. Prep. Cook. Ready In. 1  Place eggs into a saucepan and pour in cold water to cover; place over high heat. 2  When the water just starts to simmer, turn off heat, cover pan with a lid, and let stand for 17 minutes. 3  Don't peek. 4  Pour out the hot water and pour cold water over eggs.

passage 2:1 If you're not particular about how pretty your peeled eggs are, you can skip the refrigerator and start peeling them right after chilling them. 2  To test whether an egg is hard-boiled without breaking it, whirl it on a table. 3  If it spins fast and easy, it is hard boiled. 4  If it wobbles, it needs more time.

passage 3:There are two main problems when it comes to hard-boiled eggs: green-gray yolks and shells that just wonâ€™t peel off. Make hard-boiled eggs headache-free by following this easy method. First, place the cold eggs in a single layer in a pan with enough cold water to cover them by about 1 inch. Then, place the pan on the stove over high heat. Shutterstock. As soon as the water comes to a boil turn the heat off, cover the pan, and remove it from the heat. Allow the eggs to sit in the water until they are cooked; about 9 minutes for a medium egg, 12 minutes for a large egg, and 15 minutes for an extra-large egg.

"]
answer: I'm sorry for any confusion, but baking hard-boiled eggs is not the correct method. The instructions provided are for boiling hard-boiled eggs. If you meant another question related to cooking eggs, please let me know!
ground_truth: To bake a hard-boiled egg, place the eggs in a saucepan and add cold water to cover them. Place the saucepan over high heat. Once the water starts to simmer, turn off the heat, cover the pan, and let it stand for 17 minutes. Do not uncover the pan during this time. After 17 minutes, pour out the hot water and pour cold water over the eggs. To test if the egg is hard boiled, spin it on a table; if it spins fast and easily, it is hard boiled. If it wobbles, it needs more time.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here is how to bake hard-boiled eggs:

1. Place cold eggs in a single layer in a pan with enough cold water to cover them by about 1 inch.
2. Place the pan on the stove over high heat.
3. As soon as the water comes to a boil, turn the heat off, cover the pan, and remove it from the heat.
4. Allow the eggs to sit in the water for the appropriate amount of time, depending on the size of the eggs (9 minutes for medium, 12 minutes for large, and 15 minutes for extra-large).

Note: Do not peek during the cooking process, and do not worry if the eggs are not perfectly symmetrical or have a slightly greenish-gray yolk.

question: what is the drawer for on bottom of oven stove
contexts:
["passage 1:Itâ€™s called a â€œwarming drawer,â€\x9d and itâ€™s where food is supposed to be placed to stay toasty until itâ€™s ready to be eaten! Wikimedia Commons / Brown. As you can see, some models blatantly point this out on their packaging. The stove pictured above has a special label on the drawer.

passage 2:Depending on the model. January 12, 2017. Perhaps, like me, you use that drawer located underneath your stove for storing pans, cookie sheets, and muffin tins. Unfortunately, many of us have been doing it wrong, according to the good people who manufacture stoves. While it does serve as a great spot for all of your back-up cooking tools, on some oven models it's actually meant to be a warming drawer. Check the inside of the drawer or owner's manual, and you may find it says something like this: â€œThe warming drawer is designed to keep hot foods at serving temperature.

passage 3:The bottom drawer on some ovens can be used to broil or warm food. WHAT'S FALSE. Not all ovens have warming drawers, and the bottom drawer on some ovens is used for storage purposes instead. ORIGIN

"]
answer: The drawer on the bottom of an oven stove can be used as a warming drawer (on some models), or it may be used for storage purposes.
ground_truth: The drawer on the bottom of an oven stove is often called a â€œwarming drawer.â€ It is designed to keep food warm until it is ready to be eaten. However, not all models have this feature and in some oven stoves, the bottom drawer is used for storage purposes. It is suggested to check the inside of the drawer or the oven's owner manual to clarify its intended use.

question: what is psa levels mean
contexts:
['passage 1:Prostate-specific antigen, or PSA, is a protein produced by cells of the prostate gland. The PSA test measures the level of PSA in a manâ€™s blood.For this test, a blood sample is sent to a laboratory for analysis. The results are usually reported as nanograms of PSA per milliliter (ng/mL) of blood.The blood level of PSA is often elevated in men with prostate cancer, and the PSA test was originally approved by the FDA in 1986 to monitor the progression of prostate cancer in men who had already been diagnosed with the disease.he PSA test measures the level of PSA in a manâ€™s blood. For this test, a blood sample is sent to a laboratory for analysis. The results are usually reported as nanograms of PSA per milliliter (ng/mL) of blood.

passage 2:A. A. A. Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) is a substance produced by the prostate gland. Elevated PSA levels may indicate prostate cancer, a noncancerous condition such as prostatitis, or an enlarged prostate.. A. A. Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) is a substance produced by the prostate gland. Elevated PSA levels may indicate prostate cancer, a noncancerous condition such as prostatitis, or an enlarged prostate.

passage 3:1 Total PSA levels between 4.0 ng/ml and 10.0 ng/ml may indicate prostate cancer (about a 25% chance, according to the ACS), benign prostate hyperplasia (BPH) , or inflammation of the prostate. 2  These conditions are more common in the elderly, as is a general increase in PSA levels.f the DRE is normal but the PSA is moderately elevated, a free PSA test may be used to look at the ratio of free to total PSA. This can help to distinguish between prostate cancer and other non-cancer causes of elevated PSA.

']
answer: PSA levels in blood can indicate various conditions, including prostate cancer, benign prostate hyperplasia (BPH), or prostatitis. Levels between 4.0 ng/ml and 10.0 ng/ml may suggest any of these conditions.
ground_truth: PSA, or Prostate-specific antigen, is a protein produced by cells of the prostate gland. The level of PSA in a man's blood is measured by the PSA test, which involves sending a blood sample to a laboratory for analysis. The results are usually reported as nanograms of PSA per milliliter (ng/mL) of blood. Elevated PSA levels may indicate conditions such as prostate cancer, a noncancerous condition like prostatitis, or an enlarged prostate. Total PSA levels between 4.0 ng/ml and 10.0 ng/ml may indicate prostate cancer, benign prostate hyperplasia, or inflammation of the prostate.

PSA levels refer to the amount of PSA proteins present in a man's blood, and elevated levels may indicate prostate cancer, prostatitis, or an enlarged prostate.

question: how to soften sugar
contexts:
['passage 1:3-Place brown sugar in a plastic container with a small piece of plastic wrap or foil over the sugar. Put a damp paper towel or napkin on top of the plastic/foil. Cover tightly. Remove damp paper towel in a couple of days.

passage 2:A. Granulated sugar will harden when exposed to any type of moisture. Here is an easy way to make hardened granulated sugar soft again -- Preheat oven to lowest temperature, 150-200 degrees. Remove sugar from the package and put in an ovenproof container that will hold the sugar. Place in the warm oven for approximately 15 minutes. Tap sugar with a spoon. If it starts to fall apart, turn oven off and leave sugar in the oven for an hour or two to completely dry out. Always store granulated sugar in an airtight container. Store confectioners sugar in a cool, dry location (not the refrigerator). When it gets moist, it develops lumps.

passage 3:How to keep it soft. The most efficient way to keep brown sugar soft is to keep it sealed in an airtight container. The trick is to limit the amount of air exposure as much as possible. Pack the sugar into the smallest container possible so that there is hardly any air space between the sugar and the lid.

']
answer: Preheat oven to 150-200 degrees, remove sugar from the package, put it in an ovenproof container, and place it in the warm oven for approximately 15 minutes. Tap sugar with a spoon. If it starts to fall apart, turn off the oven and leave sugar in the oven for an hour or two to completely dry out.
ground_truth: To soften brown sugar, you can place it in a plastic container with a small piece of plastic wrap or foil over the sugar. Then put a damp paper towel or napkin on top of the plastic/foil and cover tightly. Remove the damp paper towel in a couple of days. To make hardened granulated sugar soft again, preheat an oven to its lowest temperature, 150-200 degrees. Remove the sugar from its package and put it in an ovenproof container. Place it in the warm oven for approximately 15 minutes. Tap the sugar with a spoon and if it starts to fall apart, turn the oven off and leave the sugar in the oven for an hour or two to completely dry out. Always store granulated sugar in an airtight container.

* Keep them sealed in an airtight container and limit the amount of air exposure as much as possible. Pack the sugar into the smallest container possible so that there is hardly any air space between the sugar and the lid. (Passage 3)
