question: how to change the sleep time on my computer
contexts:
['passage 1:Step 1: Click Start Menu to load the Help Center. Step 2: Enter Power Management Settings in the search field. Step 3: Click Change Power Management settings. The Power Options window will then appear. Step 4: On the left side of the window, click Change when the computer sleeps. Step 5: Change the Put the computer to sleep entry with the desired amount of time you will allow the computer to sit idle before it sleeps, or automatically turn off its option to enter into Sleep mode. Windows 7. Step 1: Click Start Menu, select Control Panel.

passage 2:For a lot of PCs (especially laptops and tablets), your PC goes to sleep when you close your lid or press the power button. To make your PC sleep: Open power options: For Windows 10, in the search box on the taskbar, type power options and then select Power Options.

passage 3:Select the Start button and then select Power > Shut down. For Windows 8.1 / Windows RT 8.1. Move your mouse to the lower left-hand corner of the screen and right-click the Start button or press Windows logo key + X on your keyboard. Tap or click Shut down or sign out and choose Shut down.

']
answer: For Windows 7, follow steps 1-4 from the first passage and then adjust the 'Put the computer to sleep' entry as desired in step 5. For Windows 10, type "power options" in the search box on the taskbar, select Power Options, then click on 'Change plan settings' next to your current power plan, go to 'Change advanced power settings', expand 'Sleep', and adjust 'Allow hybrid sleep after' or 'Sleep'.
ground_truth: Click on the Start Menu and enter Power Management Settings in the search field. Then click on Change Power Management settings to open the Power Options window. On the left side of the window, click on Change when the computer sleeps. From there, you can change the Put the computer to sleep entry to the desired amount of time you want your computer to sit idle before it goes to sleep.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here is how you can change the sleep time on your computer:

Passage 1:

Step 1: Click Start Menu to load the Help Center.
Step 2: Enter Power Management Settings in the search field.
Step 3: Click Change Power Management settings.
Step 4: On the left side of the window, click Change when the computer sleeps.
Step 5: Change the Put the computer to sleep entry with the desired amount of time you will allow the computer to sit idle before it sleeps, or automatically turn off its option to enter into Sleep mode.

Passage 2:

For a lot of PCs (especially laptops and tablets), your PC goes to sleep when you close your lid or press the power button.

Passage 3:

Select the Start button and then select Power > Shut down.

Therefore, to change the sleep time on your computer, you need to follow these steps:

1. Click Start Menu to load the Help Center.
2. Enter Power Management Settings in the search field.
3. Click Change Power Management settings.
4. On the left side of the window, click Change when the computer sleeps.
5. Change the Put the computer to sleep entry with the desired amount of time you will allow the computer to sit idle before it sleeps, or automatically turn off its option to enter into Sleep mode.

Alternatively, you can also use the shortcut keys Windows key + X and select Power Options from the menu to open the Power Options window directly.

ground_truth:
Sure, here's a brief answer to the question "How to change the sleep time on my computer" based on the given passages:

To change the sleep time on your computer, follow these steps:

1. Click the Start menu and select Control Panel.
2. In the Control Panel, click on Power Options.
3. In the Power Options window, click on "Change when the computer sleeps" on the left side of the window.
4. In the "Put the computer to sleep" section, change the duration of time to the desired amount of time you want the computer to sit idle before it goes to sleep.
5. Alternatively, you can also toggle off the option to enter Sleep mode automatically.

If you are using Windows 10, you can also search for "Power Options" in the taskbar search box and select it to open the Power Options window.

If you are using Windows 8.1 / Windows RT 8.1, you can move your mouse to the lower left-hand corner of the screen, right-click the Start button, and select Shut down or sign out, and then select Shut down.

question: psychological effects of hugging
contexts:
["passage 1:The physiological benefits of hugging. Hugs make you feel good for a reason and it's not just the loving embrace that gives us that warm feeling in our hearts. It's much more. It affects the entire body to such an extent that many scientists claim it is equivalent to the effect of many different drugs operating on the body simultaneously.

passage 2:Empathy and Listening Skills. and. Psychological Hugs. The use of empathy and listening skills--empathic listening--sometimes leads to good relationships, emotional intimacy, and happy marriages. Their use may also lead to a conversation partner feeling like she or he is receiving a hug--a psychological hug..

passage 3:In a study on fears and self-esteem, research published in the journal Psychological Science revealed that hugs and touch significantly reduce worry of mortality. The studies found that hugging -- even if it was just an inanimate object like a teddy bear -- helps soothe individuals' existential fears.

"]
answer: Reduces worry of mortality, improves emotional intimacy, and has effects similar to various drugs operating on the body simultaneously.
ground_truth: Hugging has significant psychological effects. It creates a warm feeling that affects the entire body, akin to the effect of many drugs operating simultaneously. This could be due to the feeling of a loving embrace, leading to good relationships and emotional intimacy. It also enhances empathy and listening skills, which can lead to a psychological hug. Furthermore, research has found that hugging can significantly reduce worries about mortality and boost self-esteem. This soothing effect can be achieved even when hugging an inanimate object like a teddy bear.

contexts:

It affects the entire body to such an extent that many scientists claim it is equivalent to the effect of many different drugs operating on the body simultaneously.

passage 2:Empathy and Listening Skills. and. Psychological Hugs. The use of empathy and listening skills--empathic listening--sometimes leads to good relationships, emotional intimacy, and happy marriages. Their use may also lead to a conversation partner feeling like she or he is receiving a hug--a psychological hug..

passage 3:In a study on fears and self-esteem, research published in the journal Psychological Science revealed that hugs and touch significantly reduce worry of mortality. The studies found that hugging -- even if it was just an inanimate object like a teddy bear -- helps soothe individuals' existential fears.

"]
answer: Reduces worry of mortality, improves emotional intimacy, and has effects similar to various drugs operating on the body simultaneously.
ground_truth: Hugging has physiological benefits and can have a similar effect on the body as certain drugs. It can also lead to emotional intimacy and happy relationships. Hugging and touch, even with inanimate objects, can help reduce existential fears and worry about mortality.

question: how to cook a small prime rib roast in oven
contexts:
["passage 1:Directions. Allow roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degree F. Rub roast with House Seasoning; place roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.Roast for 1 hour.Turn off oven.irections. Allow roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degree F. Rub roast with House Seasoning; place roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.

passage 2:1 Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!). Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!).

passage 3:1 While the roast is resting prepare the au jus; place the roasting pan on top of the stove over high heat. 2  Add in the wine; cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring and scraping any brown bits. 3  Add in the beef stock; cook and reduce the juice by half (this might take about 20 minutes). 4  Add salt and pepper to taste. Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!).

"]
answer:
1. Allow the roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour.
2. Preheat the oven to 450 degree F.
3. Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper.
4. Place the roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.
5. Roast for about 20-25 minutes per pound, or until desired doneness (for medium-rare, aim for an internal temperature of 130-135 degrees F).
6. Turn off oven and let the roast rest for at least 15 minutes before slicing.
7. Prepare au jus by placing the roasting pan on top of the stove over high heat, adding wine, cooking for 8-10 minutes, then adding beef stock and reducing juice by half. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
ground_truth: Before cooking the prime rib roast, let it stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Season the roast with a small amount of salt and lots of fresh ground black pepper. Place the roast on a rack in a pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up. Roast it in the oven for 1 hour. After cooking, you can prepare au jus by placing the roasting pan on the stove over high heat. Add wine and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring and scraping any brown bits. Add beef stock and cook to reduce the juice by half, which might take about 20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Rub roast with House Seasoning; place roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.

passage 2:1 Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!). Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!).

passage 3:1 While the roast is resting prepare the au jus; place the roasting pan on top of the stove over high heat. 2  Add in the wine; cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring and scraping any brown bits. 3  Add in the beef stock; cook and reduce the juice by half (this might take about 20 minutes). 4  Add salt and pepper to taste. Set oven to 450Â°F and allow the oven to preheat for a minimum of 15 minutes. 2  Season the roast with only a small amount of salt but lots of fresh ground black pepper pepper (that's all nothing else but a little salt and fresh ground black pepper, using any other spices will take away the flavor from the prime rib!).

"]
answer:
1. Allow the roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour.
2. Preheat the oven to 375 degree F.
3. Rub the roast with House Seasoning.
4. Place the roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.
5. Roast for 1 hour.
6. Turn off the oven and let the roast rest.
7. Preheat the oven to 450 degree F (for au jus preparation).
8. Season the roast with salt and lots of fresh ground black pepper, avoiding other spices.
9. For au jus, place the roasting pan on the stove over high heat, add wine, cook for 8-10 minutes, then add beef stock and reduce by half. Add salt and pepper to taste.
ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here is a brief answer on how to cook a small prime rib roast in the oven:

1. Allow the roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour.
2. Preheat the oven to 375Â°F.
3. Rub the roast with House Seasoning.
4. Place the roast on a rack in the pan with the rib side down and the fatty side up.
5. Roast for 1 hour.
6. Turn off the oven.
7. While the roast is resting, prepare the au jus by placing the roasting pan on the stovetop over high heat.
8. Add in wine and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring and scraping any brown bits.
9. Add in beef stock and cook to reduce the juice by half (about 20 minutes).
10. Season the au jus with salt and pepper to taste.

Note: The passages do not provide information on the size or weight of the roast, so cooking times may vary.

answer:
1. Lay two or three frames beside each other and mark the hinge placement, ensuring the same distance from the bottom edges for secure standing.

ground_truth:
To attach multiple picture frames together, you can use a couple of methods. One way is to use a stand grouping method where you select two or three frames of the same wood molding. For joining two frames, use identical frames. If you're joining three together, choose either three of the same or one which is larger to be the middle frame. Lay them beside each other to check the effect. Put two frames together back to back, and mark the hinge placement. The placement should be the same distance from the bottom edges of each frame to ensure that the grouped pictures stand securely on the table top. Attach two small hinges to the connecting sides of the frames. 

Another method involves screwing the frame to a backer board. Repeat this with each frame. Have the pictures all ready in the frames to save time. You can always unscrew them at a later date to change the picture if you want. Attach a hanging wire to the back, hang it up and step back to enjoy the results. 

If you're hanging multiple pictures together, it may be helpful to test ideas by laying the group of pictures out on the floor first.

Based on the provided passages, here are some steps for attaching multiple picture frames together:

Passage 1: Table-Stand Grouping
To join two or three frames together, you can use identical frames or one larger frame as the middle piece. Place the frames beside each other to see if you like the effect, and then mark the hinge placement on the connecting sides. Attach two small hinges to the marked areas to join the frames together.

Passage 2: Hanging Multiple Pictures Together
Before attaching the frames together, test different arrangements of the group of multiple pictures on the floor. Once you have decided on the layout, screw the frames to the backer board, repeating the process for each frame. Attach a hanging wire to the back of the frames and hang them on the wall to enjoy the finished result.

Passage 3: Attaching Frames Together
To attach two frames together, place them back to back and mark the hinge placement on the connecting sides. The placement should be the same distance from the bottom edge of each frame to ensure stability when the grouped pictures are placed on a table. Attach two small hinges to the marked areas to join the frames together.

In conclusion, the recommended method for attaching multiple picture frames together involves using identical or matching frames, marking the hinge placement on the connecting sides, and attaching small hinges to join the frames together. It's also important to test different arrangements of the group of pictures on the floor before attaching the frames together, and to ensure that the frames are securely attached to the backer board before hanging them on the wall.

Based on the given passages, here are the steps to attach multiple picture frames together:

1. Select two or three frames of the same wood molding (Passage 1).

answer:
To attach multiple picture frames together, follow these steps:

1. Lay two or three frames of the same wood molding beside each other to see if you like the effect.
2. For joining two together, use identical frames. For joining three together, choose either three of the same or one which is larger to be the middle frame.
3. Put them back to back and mark the hinge placement. The placement must be the same distance from the bottom edges of each frame to ensure that the grouped pictures stand securely on the table top.
4. Attach two small hinges to the connecting sides of the frames.
ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here's a brief answer to the question:

To attach multiple picture frames together, you can follow these steps:

1. Select two or three frames of the same wood molding.
2. Lay them beside each other to see if you like the effect.
3. Put two frames together back to back, and mark the hinge placement. The placement must be the same distance from the bottom edges of each frame to ensure that the grouped pictures stand securely on the table top.
4. Attach two small hinges to the connecting sides of the frames.
5. Repeat the process for additional frames, ensuring that the hinge placement is consistent across all frames.
6. Attach a hanging wire to the back of the grouped frames and hang them up.

Therefore, the answer is: Select frames with the same wood molding, lay them together, mark hinge placement, attach hinges, and attach a hanging wire to the back.

question: leasing meaning
contexts:
['passage 1:Freebase (0.00 / 0 votes) Rate this definition: Leasing. Leasing is a process by which a firm can obtain the use of a certain fixed assets for which it must pay a series of contractual, periodic, tax deductible payments. The lessee is the receiver of the services or the assets under the lease contract and the lessor is the owner of the assets. The relationship between the tenant and the landlord is called a tenancy, and can be for a fixed or an indefinite period of time. The consideration for the lease is called rent.

passage 2:Freebase(0.00 / 0 votes)Rate this definition: Leasing. Leasing is a process by which a firm can obtain the use of a certain fixed assets for which it must pay a series of contractual, periodic, tax deductible payments. The lessee is the receiver of the services or the assets under the lease contract and the lessor is the owner of the assets.

passage 3:A lease is a contractual arrangement calling for the lessee to pay the lessor for use of an asset. Property, buildings and vehicles are common assets that are leased. Industrial or business equipment is also leased. Broadly put, a lease agreement is a contract between two parties, the lessor and the lessee. The lessor is the legal owner of the asset; the lessee obtains the right to use the asset in return for regular rental payments. The lessee also agrees to abide by various conditions regardin

']
answer: Leasing means obtaining the use of a fixed asset through a contractual arrangement, where periodic, tax-deductible payments are made to the owner (lessor) in return for the right to use the asset.
ground_truth: Leasing is a process by which a firm or individual can obtain the use of certain fixed assets, such as property, buildings, vehicles, or business equipment, for which they must pay a series of contractual, periodic, tax-deductible payments. The party receiving the services or assets under the lease contract is known as the lessee, while the owner of the assets is known as the lessor. This relationship is often referred to as a tenancy and can be for a fixed or indefinite period of time. The payment for the lease is referred to as rent.

question: what causes necrotizing fasciitis
contexts:
["passage 1:Necrotizing Fasciitis Causes. Necrotizing fasciitis is caused by bacteria in the vast majority of cases, though fungi can also rarely lead to this condition as well.Many cases of necrotizing fasciitis are caused by group A beta-hemolytic streptococci (Streptococcus pyogenes), either individually or along with other bacterial pathogens.Group A streptococcus is the same bacteria responsible for  strep throat , impetigo (skin infection), and rheumatic fever.n many cases of necrotizing fasciitis, there is a history of prior trauma, such as a cut, scrape, insect bite, burn, or needle puncture wound. These lesions may initially appear trivial or minor. Surgical incision sites and various surgical procedures may also serve as a source of infection.

passage 2:Causes of Necrotizing Fasciitis. Necrotizing fasciitis is commonly caused by group A Streptococcus (GAS) bacteria. That's the same type of bacteria that causes strep throat.However, several types of bacteria, such as staphylococcus and others, have also been associated with the disease.Necrotizing fasciitis occurs when such bacteria infect the superficial fascia, a layer of connective tissue below the skin.owever, several types of bacteria, such as staphylococcus and others, have also been associated with the disease. Necrotizing fasciitis occurs when such bacteria infect the superficial fascia, a layer of connective tissue below the skin.

passage 3:Necrotizing fasciitis is caused by several kinds of bacteria. Some of these bacteria also cause infections such as strep throat and impetigo. Usually the infections caused by these bacteria are mild.But in rare cases they can cause a more dangerous infection.ecrotizing fasciitis is an infection caused by bacteria. It can destroy skin, fat, and the tissue covering the muscles within a very short time. The disease sometimes is called flesh-eating bacteria. When it occurs on the genitals, it is called Fournier gangrene. Necrotizing fasciitis is very rare but serious.

"]
answer: Necrotizing fasciitis is caused by several kinds of bacteria, including group A Streptococcus (GAS), staphylococcus, and others.
ground_truth: Necrotizing fasciitis is caused primarily by bacteria, specifically group A beta-hemolytic streptococci, also known as Streptococcus pyogenes. This is the same bacteria that causes strep throat, impetigo, and rheumatic fever. Other bacteria types, such as staphylococcus, are also associated with the disease. The bacteria infect the superficial fascia, a layer of connective tissue below the skin. Prior trauma, such as a cut or scrape, insect bite, burn, or needle puncture wound can serve as a source of infection as well as surgical incision sites and various surgical procedures. In rare cases, fungi can lead to this condition.

question: what is chard vegetable
contexts:
["passage 1:Swiss chard. Pronounce it: swiss shard. Also known as just plain chard, swiss chard has large, fleshy but tender deep green leaves and thick, crisp stalks. Although they're unrelated, chard is similar to spinach, but with a stronger, more assertive (some think, bitter) flavour.wiss chard. Pronounce it: swiss shard. Also known as just plain chard, swiss chard has large, fleshy but tender deep green leaves and thick, crisp stalks. Although they're unrelated, chard is similar to spinach, but with a stronger, more assertive (some think, bitter) flavour.

passage 2:Fresh young chard can be used raw in salads. Mature chard leaves and stalks are typically cooked (like in pizzoccheri) or sauteed; their bitterness fades with cooking, leaving a refined flavor which is more delicate than that of cooked spinach.hard is in the same subspecies as beetroot (garden beet) and all other beet cultivars. They are cultivated descendants of the sea beet, Beta vulgaris subsp. maritima.

passage 3:Chard. Chard is a beet that has been chosen for leaf production at the expense of storage root formation. Chard will produce fresh white, yellow or red leaf stalks. It is an attractive ornamental that adds color to the vegetable garden.hard can be harvested while the leaves are young and tender or after maturity when larger have slightly tougher stems. Chard is extremely perishable, so keep refrigerator storage time to a minimum. Store unwashed leaves in plastic bags in the crisper for 2 to 3 days.

"]
answer: Chard is a type of beet that has been chosen for leaf production instead of root formation.
ground_truth: Chard, also known as Swiss chard, is a vegetable with large, fleshy but tender deep green leaves and thick, crisp stalks. It has a flavor that is stronger and more assertive than spinach, and some people find it bitter. Chard can be eaten raw in salads when it's young, but mature leaves and stalks are usually cooked or sautÃ©ed. Chard is actually a type of beet that is grown for its leaves rather than its root. It can produce white, yellow, or red leaf stalks. Chard is highly perishable and should be kept in the refrigerator for only 2 to 3 days.

question: differences between elements compounds and mixtures
contexts:
['passage 1:Another difference between compounds and mixtures of elements is the ease with which the elements can be separated. Mixtures, such as the atmosphere, contain two or more substances that are relatively easy to separate.The individual components of a mixture can be physically separated from each other.nother difference between compounds and mixtures of elements is the ease with which the elements can be separated. Mixtures, such as the atmosphere, contain two or more substances that are relatively easy to separate.

passage 2:Best Answer: mixtures 1) elements and compounds just mix together to form a mixture and no new compound is formed. 2)A mixture has a variable composition. 3)A mixture shows the properties of constituent substances 4)The constiuents can be seperated easily byphysical method.est Answer: mixtures 1) elements and compounds just mix together to form a mixture and no new compound is formed. 2)A mixture has a variable composition. 3)A mixture shows the properties of constituent substances 4)The constiuents can be seperated easily byphysical method.

passage 3:Compounds are substances composed of two or more different elements. Compounds are also pure substances. A mixture is a physical combination of elements or compunds where the parts of the mixture are not chemically bonded and so retain their own identity.These elements and compounds can be separated by physical means.Answer #2). We are looking at the difference between elements, compounds, and mixtures. Elements are the purest form of a chemical substance and are composed of only one type of atom. In other words, all of the atoms in an element will have the same number of protons.

']
answer:
1) Elements consist of only one type of atom with the same number of protons.
2) Compounds are substances composed of two or more different elements.
3) Mixtures contain two or more substances that are relatively easy to separate.
4) The individual components of a mixture can be physically separated from each other.
5) Elements cannot be broken down into simpler substances by physical means, while compounds can be broken down into their constituent elements through chemical reactions.
6) Mixtures have a variable composition and show the properties of their constituent substances.
ground_truth: Elements are the purest form of a chemical substance and are composed of only one type of atom, meaning all the atoms in an element have the same number of protons. Compounds, on the other hand, are substances composed of two or more different elements and are also pure substances. Mixtures are physical combinations of elements or compounds where the parts of the mixture are not chemically bonded and so retain their own identity. The individual components of a mixture can be physically separated from each other. Mixtures have variable compositions and show the properties of their constituent substances. Elements and compounds just mix together to form a mixture and no new compound is formed.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, the main differences between elements, compounds, and mixtures are:

* Elements are the purest form of a chemical substance and are composed of only one type of atom. They have a fixed composition and cannot be broken down into simpler substances by physical means.
* Compounds, on the other hand, are substances composed of two or more different elements that are chemically bonded together. They have a fixed composition and are pure substances.
* Mixtures are physical combinations of elements or compounds where the parts of the mixture are not chemically bonded and retain their own identity. They have a variable composition and can be separated by physical means.

Therefore, the key differences between elements, compounds, and mixtures are their composition, bonding, and separability. Elements are homogeneous and have a fixed composition, compounds are heterogeneous and have a fixed composition, and mixtures are heterogeneous and have a variable composition. Additionally, elements and compounds are chemically bonded, while mixtures are not.

question: how to wash wine glasses properly
contexts:
["passage 1:1 If hot water and mild detergent canâ€™t get your glasses clean, use baking soda to remove any stubborn wine residue. 2  Dissolve a small amount of soda with hot water and let it stand in the glass for a few minutes. 3  The soda will dissolve any residual wine adhering to the glass.

passage 2:3. To clean the inside of a glass, use a stemware brush with soft-foam bristles. 4. After rinsing thoroughly with hot water, dry the wine glasses with a smooth lint-free cloth, such as a microfiber or flour sack towel. Editor's Tip: Red wine can leave stains if left overnight.

passage 3:Clean Your Wine Glasses by Hand. The safest cleaning method for your wine glasses is to scrub them by hand. Follow these tips to avoid chips and spots. 1. Lay a towel in the sink before filling with hot water. Wash one wine glass at a time to avoid damage. 2. To keep soap from flavoring your next glass of wine, use a small amount of detergent and use it only where it's needed -- in the bottom of the glass and around the rim. Cradle the bowl of the glass in one hand while washing to protect the stem.

"]
answer:
1. Use hot water, a small amount of mild detergent, and a stemware brush with soft-foam bristles.
2. Wash one wine glass at a time to avoid damage.
3. Avoid soap residue in the glass by using detergent only where it's needed -- in the bottom and around the rim.
4. Rinse thoroughly with hot water.
5. Dry the wine glasses with a smooth lint-free cloth, such as a microfiber or flour sack towel.
6. If there are stubborn wine residues, use baking soda to remove them before washing.
ground_truth: To properly wash wine glasses, you should scrub them by hand as it's the safest cleaning method. First, lay a towel in the sink before filling it with hot water. Wash one wine glass at a time to avoid damage. Use a small amount of detergent only where it's needed -- in the bottom of the glass and around the rim. To clean the inside of a glass, use a stemware brush with soft-foam bristles. If hot water and mild detergent canâ€™t get your glasses clean, use baking soda to remove any stubborn wine residue. Dissolve a small amount of soda with hot water and let it stand in the glass for a few minutes. The soda will dissolve any residual wine adhering to the glass. Cradle the bowl of the glass in one hand while washing to protect the stem. After rinsing thoroughly with hot water, dry the wine glasses with a smooth lint-free cloth, such as a microfiber or flour sack towel.

question: how to peel potatoes fast
contexts:
['passage 1:Place washed whole, unpeeled potatoes into a pot and cover with cold water. The â€œshockingâ€\x9d process of going from the hot boiling water to the cold ice water helps release the skin from the flesh and makes the potato quite easy to peel.

passage 2:True the skin comes off fairly easy but it takes so freakin long! Especially if you are peeling a crap load of potatoes. Here is the easiest way (or at least the easiest way Iâ€™ve discovered) to peel a cooked potato. Step 1.) Bring a pot of water to a boil. Step 2.) With a knife, score your potatoes all the way around the center. Step 3.) Place your potatoes in the pot and boil for about 15 minutes or so. Step 4.) Prepare a bowl of ice water and place your potatoes in the water. Step 5.) Swish it around for a few seconds just enough so that itâ€™s cool enough to handle. Step 6.) Remove your potatoe from the water and remove the skin.

passage 3:You will need. Step 1 Cut the potato skin Make a cut all around the potato, lengthwise. Try to slice only the skin, not the actual potato. Step 2 Boil it Put the potato in a pot of boiling water. Step 3 Cool it off Plunge the potato in ice water for 10 seconds. The surface of the potato will shrink, while the center remains hot. Step 4 Remove the skin Rub the potato with both hands and watch the skin fall right off.

']
answer: Follow these steps: Boil the potatoes (Step 2 from passage 2), score them around the center with a knife (Step 1 from passage 3), boil for about 15 minutes or so (Step 3 from passage 2), cool off in ice water for 10 seconds (Step 3 from passage 3), and then remove the skin by rubbing the potato with both hands (Step 4 from passage 3).
ground_truth: To peel potatoes fast, you should first wash the whole, unpeeled potatoes. Then make a cut all around the potato, lengthwise, being careful not to cut into the potato itself. Put these potatoes in a pot of boiling water and let them boil for about 15 minutes. Prepare a bowl of ice water and transfer the boiled potatoes into it, swishing them around for a few seconds until they are cool enough to handle. The shock from the hot water to the cold water helps the skin to release from the flesh. Finally, rub the potato with both hands to remove the skin.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here's how to peel potatoes fast:

1. Score the potatoes all the way around the center with a knife.
2. Boil the potatoes for about 15 minutes.
3. Place the potatoes in a bowl of ice water and swish them around for a few seconds.
4. Remove the potatoes from the water and remove the skin.

Alternatively, you can also try the following method:

1. Cut the potato skin, making a cut all around the potato lengthwise.
2. Boil the potato in a pot of boiling water.
3. Plunge the potato in ice water for 10 seconds.
4. Rub the potato with both hands, and the skin should fall right off.

These methods should help you peel potatoes quickly and efficiently.

question: how to fix lift valve in toilet
contexts:
['passage 1:The new flapper valve and chain for a 1.6 gallon per flush toilet. Step 1: Shutoff the water supply valve to the toilet. Step 2: Remove the old flapper valve by slipping it off the mounting arms. Remove whatâ€™s left of the broken lift chain from the lift arm.

passage 2:Step 4: Open the water valve to fill the tank. Flush the toilet to check for correct operation. If needed, readjust the lift chain by moving the metal clip up or down a couple of links. When youâ€™re satisfied, cut off the excess lift chain to prevent it from getting tangled.

passage 3:Push the small solid end of the toilet lift arm into the flush handle. If a screw is included with your part, screw it in tightly. Push it until there is no more give and it is secure. The other end will hang freely in the air. Connect the chain to the third hole on the lift arm. This is the hole closest to the edge of the lift arm. Use the pliers to make sure it is securely fastened. Turn the water valve back on and test out the flush of the toilet. If the toilet flushes slowly, adjust the chain to make it a little tighter on the lift arm.

']
answer:
1. Shut off the water supply valve to the toilet.
2. Remove the old flapper valve and broken lift chain.
3. Connect the new lift chain to the third hole on the lift arm (closest to the edge of the lift arm). Secure it using pliers.
4. Screw in the screw (if included) tightly into the toilet lift arm.
5. Open the water valve and test out the flush of the toilet. If needed, adjust the chain to make it a little tighter on the lift arm.
ground_truth: To fix a lift valve in a toilet, first shut off the water supply valve to the toilet. Then, remove the old flapper valve by slipping it off the mounting arms. Also, remove the broken lift chain from the lift arm. Push the small solid end of the toilet lift arm into the flush handle and secure it tightly with a screw if one is included. The other end of the lift arm should hang freely. Connect the chain to the third hole on the lift arm, which is the hole closest to the edge of the lift arm. Secure it with pliers. Once done, turn the water valve back on and test the toilet flush. If the flush is slow, adjust the chain to make it tighter on the lift arm. Lastly, open the water valve to fill the tank and flush the toilet to check for correct operation. If needed, readjust the lift chain by moving the metal clip up or down a few links. Cut off any excess lift chain to prevent tangling.

question: how do crab traps work
contexts:
["passage 1:Pot Design. A crab pot works like any other crustacean pot, including lobster traps, prawn traps and some minnow traps. The crab pot uses a system of nets inside a large metal cage made of wire or flat metal mesh that is reinforced with steel bars.The traps or pots are designed to allow crabs in but not let them out.etting the Catch. A crab pot is a large square about 2 feet high and 8 feet wide. Two ends have lead-ins that angle into the trap from the sides and bottom to a narrow slit about 2 feet into the pot. This slit is the only entrance into the trap. The crabs realize they must crawl up the leads to get to their free meal.

passage 2:Tweet. Your crab traps are one of the most important items in your tackle itinerary. You need them to work well and you need them to catch crabs. I recommend using the topless crab trap since these definitely seem to work best.weet. Your crab traps are one of the most important items in your tackle itinerary. You need them to work well and you need them to catch crabs. I recommend using the topless crab trap since these definitely seem to work best.

passage 3:The Trap Is Set. Pots make the big catches in the crab-fishing world, and they come in a variety of forms. According to the Alaska Department of Fish and Game, king crab pots generally range from about 6 by 6 feet to about 8 by 8 feet, with heights between about 2 and 3 feet.ossibly a section of biodegradable mesh, a dis-solvable cord or other similar device, over time these mechanisms disable crab pots, making them unable to trap any more crabs that wander inside and preventing them from ghost fishing â€” continuing to catch crabs after they're derelict.

"]
answer: Crab traps work by using a system of nets inside a large metal cage, allowing crabs in but not letting them out. The trap has an entrance through a narrow slit, and the crabs must crawl up leads to reach their food inside.
ground_truth: Crab traps, also known as pots, work by luring crabs into a large metal cage with a system of nets. The cage is reinforced with steel bars and is designed to allow crabs in but not let them out. The trap is a large square, about 2 feet high and 8 feet wide, with two ends that have lead-ins angling into the trap from the sides and bottom to a narrow slit, which is the only entrance into the trap. Crabs crawl up the leads to get to the bait. There are also topless crab traps recommended for their effectiveness. If a trap becomes derelict, it may have a section of biodegradable mesh, a dissolvable cord, or another similar device, that over time disables the trap, preventing it from continuing to catch crabs.

question: difference between feha and ada
contexts:
["passage 1:One difference between the FEHA (the Fair Employment and Housing Act) and the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) is that the ADA applies to all employers in the private sector that have four to fifteen employees, whereas the FEHA affects more employees, and it doesnâ€™t distinguish between private and public employers like the ADA does.

passage 2:Class Description: This class is designed specifically for supervisors and managers to learn the basic provisions of the California's Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and understand their responsibilities during the reasonable accommodation process.

passage 3:Probably one of the most important differences between the ADA and FEHA is that with FEHA, a disability is required. Under the ADA, to qualify for disability, a physical or mental impairment substantially limits a major life activity, but the FEHA requires only that a mental and physical disability limit a major life activity; not a substantial limit, but a limit.

"]
answer: The main difference between FEHA (Fair Employment and Housing Act) and ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) lies in the definition of a disability. While the ADA requires that a physical or mental impairment substantially limits a major life activity, the FEHA only requires that a mental and physical disability limit a major life activity, not necessarily to a substantial degree. Additionally, the FEHA applies to more employees and does not distinguish between private and public employers like the ADA does.
ground_truth: The FEHA (Fair Employment and Housing Act) and the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) have several differences. The ADA applies to all employers in the private sector that have four to fifteen employees, while the FEHA affects more employees and does not distinguish between private and public employers. Another important difference is the requirement of disability. The ADA requires a physical or mental impairment to substantially limit a major life activity, while the FEHA only requires that a mental and physical disability limit a major life activity, without the need for it to be a substantial limit.

ground_truth:
Based on the provided passages, the main differences between the Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) are:

1. Scope of application: The ADA applies to all employers in the private sector with four to fifteen employees, while the FEHA affects more employees and does not distinguish between private and public employers like the ADA does.
2. Definition of disability: The FEHA requires that a disability must limit a major life activity, while the ADA requires that a physical or mental impairment substantially limits a major life activity.
3. Number of employees: The ADA applies to employers with four to fifteen employees, while the FEHA has no such requirement.

Therefore, the main difference between FEHA and ADA is the scope of application and the definition of disability.

Additionally, the FEHA applies to more employees and does not distinguish between private and public employers like the ADA does.
ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here is the difference between the Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA):

The main difference between FEHA and ADA is the scope of coverage and the definition of disability.

1. Scope of Coverage: ADA covers all employers with four to fifteen employees in the private sector, while FEHA covers both private and public employers and has a broader scope of coverage.
2. Definition of Disability: ADA defines disability as a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits a major life activity. FEHA, on the other hand, defines disability as any mental or physical condition that limits a major life activity, without the requirement of substantial limitation.

Therefore, under FEHA, a broader range of conditions may be considered disabilities compared to ADA.

question: introduction to visual merchandising and relation to the consumer
contexts:
['passage 1:Introduction to Visual Merchandising: The visual merchandiser is aware of the retail strategy and the company goals of the retailer in order to project the same in the store. Earlier retailers used advertising as the only media to attract customers to the store.

passage 2:ROLE OF MERCHANDISER. Marketing brings horse to the water but visual merchandising makes the. horse drink. G. Surrendar. (2001)39. This chapter presents. Summary of literature published in the field of visual merchandising. specially to understand its theoretical aspects. It tries to explain how Visual.

passage 3:The main objective of this paper is to study the influence of visual merchandising, especially the one related to the shop windows, on consumer buying behaviour according to the sex, and to the store attributes most valued by consumers in shopping centres.

']
answer: The introduction to Visual Merchandising involves understanding retail strategy and company goals to reflect these in a store. It also aims to influence consumer buying behavior, as shown in the shop windows, according to sex and store attributes valued by consumers in shopping centers.
ground_truth: Visual merchandising is a strategy used by retailers to attract customers to their store and influence their buying behavior. It involves the presentation of the store and its merchandise in a way that aligns with the retailer's goals and marketing strategy. The visual merchandiser's role is crucial as they not only help bring customers to the store but also influence their purchasing decisions, akin to "making the horse drink" as per G. Surrendar's analogy. Particularly, visual merchandising related to shop windows has been found to significantly impact consumer buying behavior, with variations observed based on gender and the store attributes most valued by consumers in shopping centers.

question: earliest signs and symptoms of pregnancy
contexts:
['passage 1:1 Mood swings. 2  The flood of hormones in your body in early pregnancy can make you unusually emotional and weepy. 3  Mood swings also are common. 4  Dizziness. 5  Pregnancy causes your blood vessels to dilate and your blood pressure to drop. 6  As a result, you might find yourself feeling lightheaded or dizzy.

passage 2:The earliest signs of pregnancy are often easily overlooked. Many women know that a missed period may indicate pregnancy, but so can bloating, spotting, and cramping. Learn when and why symptoms occur in the first weeks of pregnancy.

passage 3:Around half of all pregnant women experience nausea and vomiting, and around 3 in 10 women experience nausea without vomiting. For most women who have morning sickness, the symptoms start around six weeks after their last period. Read more about coping with nausea and morning sickness in pregnancy.

']
answer: Bloating, spotting, cramping, mood swings, dizziness, and potential nausea or vomiting can be early signs of pregnancy.
ground_truth: The earliest signs of pregnancy often include mood swings and unusual emotional behavior due to a flood of hormones in the body. Dizziness can also occur as pregnancy causes blood vessels to dilate and blood pressure to drop. Other early symptoms can include a missed period, bloating, spotting, and cramping. Approximately half of all pregnant women experience nausea and vomiting, and around 3 in 10 women experience nausea without vomiting, with these symptoms typically starting around six weeks after their last period.

question: what is severe osteoporosis
contexts:
["passage 1:Osteoporosis can be a silent disease, but many patients suffer symptoms such as pain and height loss. Read a brief description of osteoporosis symptoms. Compression Fractures of the Back. Sudden, severe back pain, especially in older women, often signifies a spinal compression fracture -- a sign of weak bones.steoporosis can be a silent disease, but many patients suffer symptoms such as pain and height loss. Read a brief description of osteoporosis symptoms. Compression Fractures of the Back. Sudden, severe back pain, especially in older women, often signifies a spinal compression fracture -- a sign of weak bones.

passage 2:The most common cause of osteoporosis pain is a spinal compression fracture. If you have been diagnosed with osteoporosis, or if you have several risk factors for osteoporosis, these symptoms may indicate a compression fracture 1  : Sudden, severe back pain that gets worse when you are standing or walking.2  Some pain relief when lying down.edication to Relieve Osteoporosis Pain. Medication is the most popular way to manage osteoporosis pain. Drugs include: 1  Over-the-counter pain medications like acetaminophen, aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen are safe pain relievers for most people. 2  These may cause stomach irritation and bleeding or liver problems.

passage 3:Osteoporosis is a condition that has virtually no symptoms until severe bone damage has already occurred. Once the bones have been weakened by bone density loss, symptoms may include: 1  Back pain.2  Loss of height over time with stooped posture. 3  Fractures of the vertebrae, wrists, hips or other bones.ithout treatment, a person with osteoporosis is likely to have fractures, most often in the spine or hips (which support the body's weight) or in the wrists from bracing against a fall. Fractures of the spine can happen even without a fall or an injury. The bones of the spine become so weak that they start to compress.

"]
answer: Severe osteoporosis is characterized by significant bone density loss, leading to symptoms such as back pain, height loss, and fractures (especially in the spine, hips, or wrists) without a fall or injury.
ground_truth: The passages do not explicitly define severe osteoporosis. However, they indicate that osteoporosis is a condition characterized by weakened bones, often resulting in pain, height loss, and fractures, particularly in the spine, hips, or wrists. Severe osteoporosis could presumably refer to an advanced stage of the disease where symptoms and bone damage are significant.

Drugs include: 1  Over-the-counter pain medications like acetaminophen, aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen are safe pain relievers for most people. 2  These may cause stomach irritation and bleeding or liver problems.

passage 3:Osteoporosis is a condition that has virtually no symptoms until severe bone damage has already occurred. Once the bones have been weakened by bone density loss, symptoms may include: 1  Back pain.2  Loss of height over time with stooped posture. 3  Fractures of the vertebrae, wrists, hips or other bones.ithout treatment, a person with osteoporosis is likely to have fractures, most often in the spine or hips (which support the body's weight) or in the wrists from bracing against a fall. Fractures of the spine can happen even without a fall or an injury. The bones of the spine become so weak that they start to compress.

"]
answer: Severe osteoporosis is characterized by significant bone density loss, leading to symptoms such as back pain, height loss, and fractures (especially in the spine, hips, or wrists) without a fall or injury.
ground_truth: Based on the provided passages, severe osteoporosis refers to a condition where there is significant bone density loss, leading to symptoms such as sudden and severe back pain, loss of height, and an increased risk of fractures, particularly in the spine, hips, and wrists.

question: difference between an adverb clause and an adjective clause
contexts:
['passage 1:An adverb clause is a dependent clause that modifies a verb, adjective or another adverb. It usually modifies the verb. passage 2:Parts of the Sentence - Adjective, Adverb, and Noun Clauses. The adjective clause is used to modify a noun or a pronoun. It will begin with a relative pronoun (who, whose, whom, which, and that) or a subordinate conjunction (when and where). Those are the only words that can be used to introduce an adjective clause.

passage 3:Adjective Clauses. Adjective clauses are dependent clauses that modify nouns or pronouns. Much like adverbial clauses, students who are trying to identify adjective clauses should try to determine what kinds of questions the clause in questions answers.

']
answer: An adverb clause modifies a verb, adjective or another adverb (usually the verb), while an adjective clause modifies a noun or pronoun. Adverb clauses are introduced by subordinate conjunctions such as after, although, as, etc., whereas adjective clauses begin with a relative pronoun (who, whose, whom, which, and that) or a subordinate conjunction (when and where).
ground_truth: The main difference between an adverb clause and an adjective clause is what they modify and how they are introduced. An adverb clause is a dependent clause that usually modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb and are introduced by subordinate conjunctions including after, although, as, as if, before, because, if, since, so that, than, though, unless, until, when, where, and while. An adjective clause, on the other hand, is used to modify a noun or a pronoun, and it begins with a relative pronoun (who, whose, whom, which, and that) or a subordinate conjunction (when and where).

']
answer: An adverb clause modifies a verb, adjective or another adverb (usually the verb), while an adjective clause modifies a noun or pronoun. Adverb clauses are introduced by subordinate conjunctions such as after, although, as, etc., whereas adjective clauses begin with a relative pronoun (who, whose, whom, which, and that) or a subordinate conjunction (when and where).
ground_truth:
Sure! Based on the given passages, here's the difference between an adverb clause and an adjective clause:

An adverb clause modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb, and it is introduced by subordinate conjunctions such as after, although, as, as if, before, because, if, since, so that, than, though, unless, until, when, where, and while.

An adjective clause, on the other hand, modifies a noun or pronoun and begins with a relative pronoun (who, whose, whom, which, and that) or a subordinate conjunction (when and where).

So, the main difference is that adverb clauses modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs, while adjective clauses modify nouns or pronouns.

Here are some examples of each type of clause:

Adverb clause:

* Although I studied hard, I failed the exam. (modifying the verb "failed")
* She walked slowly so that she would not fall. (modifying the verb "walked")

Adjective clause:

* The book that is on the table is mine. (modifying the noun "book")
* He is the man whom I met yesterday. (modifying the noun "man")

question: how to cook a frozen pork loin roast in the oven
contexts:
["passage 1:How to cook a frozen pork roastDefrost first. If you do not have time to defrost first; put in the oven @ 250 F. for about 1 hour. Take it out, season it. Turn your oven up to 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through!ow to cook a frozen pork roastDefrost first. If you do not have time to defrost first; put in the oven @ 250 F. for about 1 hour. Take it out, season it. Turn your oven up to 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through!

passage 2:Instructions. Preheat your oven to 325 degrees F. Place your frozen pork roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper and any seasonings you desire.Thyme, oregano or garlic are good choices for pork roasts.Place the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Determine the cooking time.lace your frozen pork roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper and any seasonings you desire. Thyme, oregano or garlic are good choices for pork roasts. Place the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Determine the cooking time.

passage 3:To cook a frozen pork loin, start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Put the frozen pork loin in a shallow baking pan on top of a roasting rack with the fat of the pork loin facing upwards.Next, cook the pork loin for about 20-30 minutes per pound. Insert a meat thermometer, and test the meat after cooking.When internal temperature of the meat is 150 degrees Fahrenheit, the meat is ready to be taken out of the oven. Cover the roast with aluminum foil, and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.urn your oven up to â€¦ 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through! Take out and cove with a tea towel until ready to cut and serve. Enjoy I agree that you need to defrost it first. Here's an excellent clue not only for pork, but for any roasts.

"]
answer: Preheat your oven to 325 degrees F. Place your frozen pork loin roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper, and any seasonings you desire (such as thyme, oregano, or garlic). Put the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Cook for about 1 hour at 325 degrees F, then turn your oven up to 350 degrees F and cook for an additional 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast), making sure it's cooked all the way through. Cover with aluminum foil and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.
ground_truth: To cook a frozen pork loin roast in the oven, start by preheating the oven to 325-350 degrees Fahrenheit. If you don't have time to defrost the roast, put it in the oven at 250 F for about an hour. Afterwards, take it out and season it with salt, pepper, and any seasonings you prefer, such as thyme, oregano or garlic. Rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Place the roast in a roasting pan with the fat of the pork loin facing upwards, and put it back in the oven for about 1.5 to 3 hours depending on its size, or about 20-30 minutes per pound. Make sure the roast is cooked thoroughly by using a meat thermometer; the internal temperature should reach 150 degrees Fahrenheit. Once it is cooked, cover the roast with aluminum foil and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.

contexts:
["passage 1:How to cook a frozen pork roastDefrost first. If you do not have time to defrost first; put in the oven @ 250 F. for about 1 hour. Take it out, season it. Turn your oven up to 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through!ow to cook a frozen pork roastDefrost first. If you do not have time to defrost first; put in the oven @ 250 F. for about 1 hour. Take it out, season it. Turn your oven up to 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through!

passage 2:Instructions. Preheat your oven to 325 degrees F. Place your frozen pork roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper and any seasonings you desire.Thyme, oregano or garlic are good choices for pork roasts.Place the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Determine the cooking time.lace your frozen pork roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper and any seasonings you desire. Thyme, oregano or garlic are good choices for pork roasts. Place the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Determine the cooking time.

passage 3:To cook a frozen pork loin, start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Put the frozen pork loin in a shallow baking pan on top of a roasting rack with the fat of the pork loin facing upwards.Next, cook the pork loin for about 20-30 minutes per pound. Insert a meat thermometer, and test the meat after cooking.When internal temperature of the meat is 150 degrees Fahrenheit, the meat is ready to be taken out of the oven. Cover the roast with aluminum foil, and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.urn your oven up to â€¦ 350 F. Put in the oven for 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast). Make sure roast is cooked all the way through! Take out and cove with a tea towel until ready to cut and serve. Enjoy I agree that you need to defrost it first. Here's an excellent clue not only for pork, but for any roasts.

"]
answer: Preheat your oven to 325 degrees F. Place your frozen pork loin roast in a roasting pan and rub the surface with 2 tsp. of olive oil. Season the outside of the roast with salt, pepper, and any seasonings you desire (such as thyme, oregano, or garlic). Put the roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven. Cook for about 1 hour at 325 degrees F, then turn your oven up to 350 degrees F and cook for an additional 1.5 - 3 hours (according to size of roast), making sure it's cooked all the way through. Cover with aluminum foil and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.
ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, here's how to cook a frozen pork loin roast in the oven:

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Place the frozen pork loin in a shallow baking pan on top of a roasting rack with the fat of the pork loin facing upwards.
3. Cook the pork loin for about 20-30 minutes per pound.
4. Insert a meat thermometer and test the meat after cooking.
5. When the internal temperature of the meat reaches 150 degrees Fahrenheit, cover the roast with aluminum foil and let it sit for 30 minutes before serving.

So, the steps to cook a frozen pork loin roast in the oven are: preheat the oven, place the roast in a shallow baking pan, cook for 20-30 minutes per pound, check the internal temperature, cover and let it sit before serving.

question: what is the proper way to fertilize your grass
contexts:
["passage 1:Fertilize at the right time of year. In order to your fertilizer to work best, you'll need to time it so that you fertilize at the beginning of the growing season. This is different for different types of grasses. Fertilize warm season grasses when the grass begins to turn green at the beginning of spring.

passage 2:Picking Out Fertilizer. 1  1. Know your grass. The type of grass you have will determine what type of fertilizer you need to use, and how often you need to fertilize. 2  2. Do a pH soil test. This measures the alkalinity or acidity of the soil, and helps to determine what pH your fertilizer should have. 3  3. Measure your lawn.

passage 3:Pour in the rest of the fertilizer. Apply the rest of fertilizer in a perpendicular pattern. Step on the turf and if the leaf blade bounces back up, your lawn is in good shape. If it lays flat, you've over-fertilized.

"]
answer:
1. Know your grass type.
2. Do a pH soil test.
3. Measure your lawn area.
4. Fertilize at the beginning of the growing season (spring for warm-season grasses).
5. Apply the rest of the fertilizer in a perpendicular pattern and step on the turf to check if it bounces back up, not laying flat.
ground_truth: The proper way to fertilize your grass involves several steps. First, you need to fertilize your lawn at the right time of year, which should be at the beginning of the growing season. This varies for different types of grasses. For warm season grasses, fertilize when the grass starts to turn green in early spring. Secondly, you need to know your grass type as it will determine the kind of fertilizer you need to use and how often you need to fertilize. You should then do a pH soil test to measure the alkalinity or acidity of the soil, which helps to determine the proper pH level of your fertilizer. Also, you should measure your lawn. After doing these, pour in the rest of the fertilizer in a perpendicular pattern. Make sure not to over-fertilize by stepping on the turf to check if the leaf blade bounces back up. If it lays flat, you've over-fertilized.

answer:
1. Know your grass type.
2. Do a pH soil test.

ground_truth:
Based on the given passages, the proper way to fertilize your grass is to:

1. Fertilize at the right time of year, which is the beginning of the growing season.
2. Know your grass type to determine the appropriate fertilizer to use and the frequency of fertilization.
3. Conduct a pH soil test to determine the pH level of the soil and select a fertilizer accordingly.
4. Measure your lawn to determine the correct amount of fertilizer to apply.
5. Apply the fertilizer in a perpendicular pattern.
6. Step on the turf and check if the leaf blade bounces back up, indicating that your lawn is in good shape.
7. Avoid over-fertilizing, as it can cause the grass to lay flat.

Therefore, the proper way to fertilize your grass involves timing, knowing your grass type, pH testing, measuring, applying in a perpendicular pattern, and avoiding over-fertilizing.

question: what are examples of potential and kinetic energy?
contexts:
['passage 1:The kinetic energy of an object depends on both its mass and velocity, with its velocity playing a much greater role. Examples of Kinetic Energy: 1. An airplane has a large amount of kinetic energy in flight due to its large mass and fast velocity. 2. A baseball thrown by a pitcher, although having a small mass, can have a large amount of kinetic energy due to its fast velocity. 3.

passage 2:Examples of Potential Energy and Kinetic Energy. Potential energy is that energy stored in any body whereas kinetic energy is the energy a body possesses by its motion. We see many a activities across us like a car moves,a ball rolls, river flows, an athlete runs, rides in amusement park, a satellite in orbit etc.

passage 3:Gravitational Potential Energy. The two examples above illustrate the two forms of potential energy to be discussed in this course-gravitational potential energy and elastic potential energy. Gravitational potential energy is the energy stored in an object as the result of its vertical position or height.

']
answer: Examples of Potential Energy include a car moving uphill, a ball at the top of a tower, and a satellite in orbit. Examples of Kinetic Energy include a car moving downhill, a ball rolling from the top of a tower, an airplane in flight, and a baseball thrown by a pitcher.
ground_truth: Examples of kinetic energy include an airplane in flight, due to its large mass and fast velocity, and a baseball thrown by a pitcher, which can have a large amount of kinetic energy due to its fast velocity. Examples of potential energy include gravitational potential energy, which is the energy stored in an object as the result of its vertical position or height, and elastic potential energy. Other activities like a car moving, a ball rolling, a river flowing, an athlete running, rides in an amusement park, and a satellite in orbit also involve potential and kinetic energy.

question: how to make hot water heater circulate
contexts:
['passage 1:For a modest sized pump, this might be 400 to 800 KWH a year if the pump runs all the time. Heat loss from the pipe. Whenever the two pipes are hot, they will be losing heat. This heat comes from the hot water tank, and the water heater must use more fuel to provide the heat.

passage 2:When a homeowner turns on a faucet, the cooled water sitting in the pipes circulates to the faucet first, so the homeowner has to wait for hot water. A hot water circulation pump sends cool water in the pipes back to the water heater through a return line. A pump circulates this water through the water heater as needed to keep it hot. This continuous loop of water through the water heater ensures that hot water is always available.

passage 3:Instead, recirculating pumps rapidly pull hot water from a water heater, while simultanously send cool water from the hot water lines back to the water heater to be reheated and reused. Demand systems can be controlled by the push of a button, a timer, or motion sensor.

']
answer: Answer: By using a hot water circulation pump (as described in passage 2) or a recirculating pump (as described in passage 3).
ground_truth: To make a hot water heater circulate, a hot water circulation pump is needed. This pump sends cool water in the pipes back to the water heater through a return line. The pump circulates this water through the water heater as needed to keep it hot, ensuring hot water is always available. Alternatively, recirculating pumps can be used to rapidly pull hot water from a water heater, while simultaneously sending cool water from the hot water lines back to the water heater to be reheated and reused. These systems can be controlled by the push of a button, a timer, or a motion sensor. However, it should be noted that heat loss from the pipes can occur, requiring the water heater to use more fuel.

question: what causes watermelons to explode
contexts:
["passage 1:Place a bunch of rubber bands around the middle of the watermelon. Be careful though as all that pressure from the outsite will start to explode the watermelon. Rubber bands are a great example of potential energy. Potential energy is energy that is stored up, not being used, just waiting to be unleashed.

passage 2:It's a bad idea to try to recreate an exploding water melon. It's possible to recreate an explosion with a chemical procedure but this involves volatile gases and liquids. Ask your chemistry or science teacher - they may know how to do it and be willing to recreate the exploding water melon for your class!

passage 3:The gas will try its best to escape the water melon but as it slowly increases due to the rotting in the water melon, the pressure will continue to increase. When the skin of the watermelon is no longer strong enough to hold the gas inside, it will explode, often spraying all nearby surfaces with rotten water melon.

"]
answer: The explosion of a watermelon is caused by an increase in pressure due to the production and accumulation of gases during its rotting process.
ground_truth: Watermelons can explode due to external pressure, such as when a bunch of rubber bands are placed around the middle of the watermelon, causing potential energy to build up and eventually cause the watermelon to explode. Another cause of watermelon explosions is the buildup of gas inside the watermelon due to rotting. This increases the internal pressure and when the skin of the watermelon can no longer hold the gas inside, it will explode.

question: how can i check taxes were filed

Give them adequate time before checking on the status of your refund. 1  If you e-filed your taxes, you should be able to get a refund status within 72 hours. 2  If you mail your taxes, you will have to wait 3 or 4 weeks after mailing in your taxes.

passage 2:Three Methods: Checking the Status of a Federal Tax Return Online Checking the Status of a Federal Tax Return over the Phone Checking the Status of State Tax Return. If you are due money back on your federal or state taxes, you'll want to know when you can expect that rebate check or direct deposit to arrive.If asking about a tax return filed with the United States federal government, you can check either online or by phoning the IRS.t takes time for the IRS to process your taxes. Give them adequate time before checking on the status of your refund. 1  If you e-filed your taxes, you should be able to get a refund status within 72 hours. 2  If you mail your taxes, you will have to wait 3 or 4 weeks after mailing in your taxes.

passage 3:You'll need your Social Security number, your tax filing status and the amount of any refund due. If you e-filed your return, wait 24 hours after the IRS acknowledged receipt of your return.f you provide your email address, most tax software will send you an email confirmation when the IRS accepts your tax return. Software programs also typically have an application that allows you to check the status of your return by logging into your account.

"]
answer: To check if your taxes were filed, you can use your tax software's application or website to log in and view the status of your return. If you e-filed your return, wait 24 hours after the IRS acknowledges receipt before checking the status. You will need your Social Security number, your tax filing status, and the amount of any refund due for this process.
ground_truth: You can check if your taxes were filed by using the IRS2Go smartphone application, checking online, or phoning the IRS directly. If you e-filed your taxes, you should be able to get a refund status within 72 hours. If you mailed your taxes, you will have to wait 3 or 4 weeks after mailing in your taxes. You'll need your Social Security number, your tax filing status and the amount of any refund due to check the status of your return. Most tax software will send you an email confirmation when the IRS accepts your tax return.

question: what is the effect of carbon footprint
contexts:
["passage 1:Your carbon footprint measures the environmental impact of your lifestyle. Everything you do has an impact --- positive or negative --- on the environment. That's the concept behind your carbon footprint, which is one method of measuring the environmental effect of your lifestyle. A carbon footprint, measured in tons, indicates the amount of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases that are produced as a result of your daily activities. You can reduce your footprint by changing the way you live your life. Even seemingly tiny changes can make a significant difference.

passage 2:It all comes back to the average carbon footprint. The average per capita carbon footprint is 6 tons per year. In the U.S. the average is 20 tons per year, and a third of that is created by automobile emissions -- meaning your car itself can put out over 6 tons of C02 a year -- enough for two people.

passage 3:So what exactly is a carbon footprint? In simplest terms, carbon footprint is the total amount of greenhouse gases produced by various human activities within a given time frame. Carbon footprint is usually measured in tons of carbon dioxide (CO2) released into the atmosphere. Your home has a carbon footprint if you use oil, coal or gas to heat it. That cheeseburger at your favorite restaurant has a carbon footprint: raising the beef and wheat and operating the restaurant all involves greenhouse gases. Your car has a carbon footprint, dependent on the vehicleâ€™s fuel consumption and driving distance.

"]
answer: The effect of carbon footprint is an environmental impact, specifically the release of greenhouse gases into the atmosphere, contributing to climate change.
ground_truth: A carbon footprint measures the environmental impact of an individual's lifestyle, indicating the amount of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases that are produced as a result of daily activities. It encompasses everything from the use of oil, coal, or gas to heat a home, to the emissions from a car, to the greenhouse gases involved in producing food. The average carbon footprint per person is 6 tons per year, though in the U.S. the average is higher at 20 tons per year, with a third of that created by automobile emissions. Changes in lifestyle can reduce one's carbon footprint and hence the negative impact on the environment.

question: how well do patterned rollers work
contexts:
['passage 1:In fact, homemade texture or decorative paint rollers can work better than the commercial variety because many faux finishes rely on applying a random pattern of texture to your walls, and commercial texture rollers apply paint with a set pattern.

passage 2:I have been using the Dermaroller for a couple of months now and I think it does make a difference in my skin. I have been using the 1mm and it seems like it works better on my face than my neck and chest. When I tried the 1mm on those areas, they got super red, so I stopped. It seems like it is stimulating my skin and it looks younger and I have noticed that it has more of a healthy glow as well. We have so many before and after pictures on our site, so I can see that it does work as well. I have found that they do work best with the serums or moisturizers used right after. We do have a great kit that is perfect for anti-aging.

passage 3:Basic Texture Roller. Place a roller pad with 1-inch or thicker nap (padding) on a roller frame. An old pad that has been used and not thoroughly cleaned (so some of the tufts clump together) works best for this. Stretch and twist rubber bands around the pad at a variety of angles, creating clumps and random patterns with tufts and lines. Apply paint to your walls with this roller as you would with any roller, but slightly adjust the rubber bands periodically as you work to renew the texture.

']
answer: Patterned rollers work well for applying a random pattern of texture to surfaces, such as in faux finishes on walls.
ground_truth: Based on the passages, patterned rollers can work well for both painting and skincare applications. For painting, homemade patterned rollers can work better than commercial ones as they provide a random pattern which is favourable for many faux finishes. question: how to boil potatoes for easy peeling
contexts:
['passage 1:Boil until tender, then transfer to an ice water bath. When cool, peel off skin. (15 minutes to cook, 5 seconds to peel each cooked potato) And now, an epic demonstration of How to Peel 2 Pounds of Potatoes in Under A Minute using a drill, (clean) toilet brush, bucket, and water hose. GAME. CHANGER.

passage 2:This versatile medium-starch spud has a delicious, buttery flavor. It cooks up tender and holds its shape, but it also has just enough starch to contribute creaminess without making a potato salad mushy. Its skin can be tough and papery, so we recommend peeling them first.

passage 3:Especially if you are peeling a crap load of potatoes. Here is the easiest way (or at least the easiest way Iâ€™ve discovered) to peel a cooked potato. Step 1.) Bring a pot of water to a boil. Step 2.) With a knife, score your potatoes all the way around the center. Step 3.) Place your potatoes in the pot and boil for about 15 minutes or so. Step 4.) Prepare a bowl of ice water and place your potatoes in the water. Step 5.) Swish it around for a few seconds just enough so that itâ€™s cool enough to handle. Step 6.) Remove your potatoe from the water and remove the skin.

']
answer: Boil potatoes for about 15 minutes, then transfer them to an ice water bath. After cooling, peel off the skin. (Step 3 and Step 6 in passage 3)
ground_truth: To boil potatoes for easy peeling, bring a pot of water to a boil and score your potatoes all the way around the center. Place the potatoes in the pot and boil for about 15 minutes. When they are tender, transfer them to a bowl of ice water and swish them around for a few seconds until they are cool enough to handle. You can then easily remove the skin.
